programme.desc: Ross Kemp examines the April 2015 heist in London's diamond district, when a group of career criminals broke into a safe deposit facility and stole approximately £14million in precious metals, cash and jewels, an event dubbed the biggest burglary of its type in British history. programme.title: Birds of a Feather
programme.desc: Dorien may have ulterior motives for inviting Tracey to a posh event, while Sharon makes a tidy profit out of fake Rolling Stones T-shirts. Comedy, starring Pauline Quirke, Linda Robson and Lesley Joseph

programme.title: Birds of a Feather
programme.desc: Tracey spreads her wings for the first time since her husband was put behind bars, and invites a handsome footballer round for dinner. Meanwhile, Sharon discovers the joys of literature. Comedy, starring Pauline Quirke, Linda Robson and Lesley Joseph

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Stamp finds few of his colleagues are prepared to stand by him when he is accused of sexually abusing young Lee Dwyer and feels even more betrayed when Carver agrees to be the boy's family liaison officer. Kane and Rickman investigate a teenage girl's disappearance and Bradford schemes to seduce Young's fiance

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Smooth-talking new arrival DS Phil Hunter swans into Sun Hill and straight away earns himself a reputation as a bad lad by flirting shamelessly with suspects' wives. DI Alex Cullen is furious to learn the investigation into Liz Chambers' murder has been transferred to the Barton Street station, the past comes back to haunt Taviner and a drug dealer targets Rickman for a spot of blackmail

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: A traumatised Stamp struggles to put the false paedophile accusations behind him and get on with his life, but finds it impossible to forgive and forget former friend Jim Carver's betrayal. There's also further dissent in the ranks between Chandler and his persistent foes Meadows and Webb - but at least Gilmore's misfortunes provide a little light relief. Graham Cole, Mark Wingett and Hywel Simons star

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: McAllister is glowing with delight after seeing the first hospital scan of her unborn child, but her joy is soured when Chandler goes to extreme lengths to persuade her to have an abortion. Kane tries to unearth the truth about troubled Lee Dwyer and Meadows faces a dilemma involving two conflicting tip-offs

programme.title: Miss Marple
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. A newlywed, recently arrived in England from New Zealand, sees disturbing visions of a strangled corpse in the hallway of her dream home. Joan Hickson stars as the amateur detective determined to get to the bottom of the mystery

programme.title: Catherine Cookson's A Dinner of Herbs
programme.desc: First in a two-part drama, starring Billie Whitelaw as a herbalist who takes an 11-year-old orphan under her wing. The youngster soon makes friends with a local girl and the future looks rosy - but heartbreak is waiting just around the corner. With Tim Healy, Jonathan Kerrigan and Michael Jayston

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Jenny is seconded to a short-staffed hospital in London, but grows increasingly reluctant to carry out her duties when she finds out she is working under intimidating surgeon Mr Tracey. Back in Poplar, the midwives are introduced to newcomer Jane and outspoken twins Meg and Mave Carter. The sisters are identical in every way, except one of them is now pregnant - forcing them to come to terms with the impact a baby will have on them. Jessica Raine and Bryony Hannah star

programme.title: Atlantic Crossing
programme.desc: Martha uses dinner table tactics to help Norway - as the American First Lady gives her some unusual oratory lessons, the US President finds himself on dangerous ground with her

programme.title: Inspector Alleyn Mysteries
programme.desc: The investigation into the murder of a model at a summer school for artists leads Inspector Alleyn to encounter a painter he met during his holiday. Pilot episode of the crime drama featuring Ngaio Marsh's aristocratic detective, starring Patrick Malahide

programme.title: McMafia
programme.desc: As the English-raised son of Russian exiles with a mafia history, Alex Godman has been intent on escaping the shadow of that criminal past, building his own legitimate business and forging a life with girlfriend Rebecca. But when his family's past returns to threaten them, he is forced to confront his values to protect those he loves and struggle against the lures of corruption in the modern world and in himself. Thriller inspired by Misha Glenny's bestseller, starring James Norton, Juliet Rylance and David Strathairn

programme.title: The Inspector Lynley Mysteries
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. When the body of a woman is found, all evidence points to suicide - but Havers is adamant foul play has occurred. Reinstated to the rank of Detective Sergeant and paired once more with Lynley, she sets out to uncover the mysteries surrounding the victim. The trail leads the pair to an exclusive club where Havers goes undercover to delve beneath the respectable surface and find the killer. Jenny Agutter guest stars, with Nathaniel Parker and Sharon Small

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The unsolved-crime squad reopens the case of an Asian woman who was attacked eight years ago, and has been in a coma ever since. After enlisting the aid of a community liaison officer, it becomes apparent there is conflict in the victim's family, as well as a possible connection with the disappearance of a private detective. Nina Wadia, Keith Allen and Navin Chowdhry guest star

programme.title: Leonardo
programme.desc: Drama series set against the backdrop of Renaissance Italy, starring Aidan Turner as Leonardo da Vinci, and beginning in Milan in 1506, as Leonardo is arrested for poisoning Caterina de Cremona

programme.title: Pie in the Sky
programme.desc: Crabbe investigates a death in Wychwold, which may have been racially motivated. Richard Griffiths stars

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: PC Young acts as bait to catch a flasher terrorising Sun Hill, and an eyewitness to the armed robbery comes forward, bringing CID a step closer to finding the gang responsible. Pc Best has a humiliating experience, while DS McAllister returns to work sporting a black eye - much to the dismay of Chandler, who is terrified she will name him as her assailant. Natalie Roles and Steven Hartley star

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: On a new year road trip to compete for funding worth millions of pounds, Jac, Ric and Sacha confront some old enemies. Meanwhile, Serena's worst fears are realised when a loved one is brought in for emergency surgery

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: The truth about Connie's illness is out, following her dramatic collapse while at work. As she recovers, she is devastated to hear that her colleagues are aware of her terminal diagnosis. Worse still is the news that her tumour has grown, and complications now mean that her consultant refuses to operate. Discharging herself, Connie persuades Ethan to drive her to London for a second opinion, but when she loses consciousness en route and is rushed into emergency surgery, her put-upon protege faces an agonising wait for news. Meanwhile, back at the ED, Dylan struggles to hold the fort, in the absence of more experienced hands

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: The Sun Hill bobbies are bemused when a new front-desk officer takes up her post - why does she look so strangely familiar? Trouble brews between Meadows and Gina Gold following the latter's arrest of a flasher who just happens to be a vital witness in CID's armed robbery investigation - and further inter-departmental clashes are on the cards after an assault outside a pub casts suspicion on a violent ex-con. Starring Simon Rouse, Roberta Taylor and Moya Brady

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Is it over for Lynne and Garry? Robbie and Mo both hatch schemes while Sam's plan leads to a nasty shock

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Kat's planned reconciliation with Zoe is scuppered by a visitor, while Pauline arranges Martin's birthday tea

programme.title: Howards' Way
programme.desc: Avril tell Charles she and Tom have split up, and Mark punishes Ken and Sarah for their adultery

programme.title: Pie in the Sky
programme.desc: A luncheon given by the area's new police caterers for local bigwigs is sabotaged, leaving Crabbe spoiled for choice when it comes to suspects. Detective drama, starring Richard Griffiths, Maggie Steed and Malcolm Sinclair

programme.title: Peak Practice
programme.desc: Jack struggles to save an asthmatic schoolgirl's life when her mother will only resort to faith healing. Meanwhile, Will has survived his breakdown and is eager to go back to work, determined he and Sarah will resolve their problems. Drama, starring Kevin Whately and Amanda Burton

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Jean models a party for the residents of an old people's home after the example set by Lionel's visiting father - but he is not the paragon of old age he pretends to be. Bittersweet comedy, starring Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer

programme.title: Are You Being Served?
programme.desc: Old Mr Grace asks the staff to come up with money-making ideas, including after-hours use of the shop. The employees decide to host a night club on the first floor. John Inman and Molly Sugden star

programme.title: To the Manor Born
programme.desc: Audrey reprimands DeVere for not fulfilling his duties as lord of the manor when he fails to attend church on Sunday, but then forgets to practise what she preaches. Penelope Keith and Peter Bowles star

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Foggy, Clegg and Compo try to make Sid appear dashing in Ivy's eyes, convincing Weasley to use him in his latest experiment. Comedy, starring Brian Wilde, John Comer and Gordon Wharmby

programme.desc: Feature-length episode. When the body of a woman is found, all evidence points to suicide - but Havers is adamant foul play has occurred. programme.desc: Lorry driver Ronnie is suspected of helping crooks steal a cargo from his employers. Drama, starring Ricky Tomlinson and Diane Parish

programme.title: Bad Girls
programme.desc: Colin feels increasingly attracted to Yvonne, who becomes the target of another of Jim's twisted schemes, Julie S agonises over a health scare and Neil cannot hide his disgust when Di shares the news of her pregnancy with all and sundry. Meanwhile, Buki is thrilled to receive a letter from her long-lost son, but her joy turns to frustration when she is refused permission to send a reply to the youngster

programme.desc: Crabbe just wants to be left alone to perfect his sorbet recipe, but chef Steve keeps getting himself arrested and Alec has girlfriend trouble. Light-hearted crime drama, starring Richard Griffiths

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: The Sun Hill bobbies are bemused when a new front-desk officer takes up her post - why does she look so strangely familiar? programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: A face from the past continues to wreak havoc when he returns to Holby. Nicky and Cameron go head to head when Jac offers one of them an opportunity for promotion. And Serena shepherds her flock down on AAU, when an old associate arrives and upsets the status quo

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Max is reunited with James, and old friend from medical school, who enters the ED with his fiancee Aisha after she falls victim to a seemingly spontaneous acid attack. The encounter also gives him cause to re-evaluate his relationship with his estranged wife Zoe, who has arrived at the hospital seeking a reconciliation. Meanwhile, Elle reveals she wants to tell Blake that Jacob is his father, and when the lad is admitted to the department with a compass stuck through his hand, now seems as good a time as any

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: The owner of a medical research establishment begins receiving threats, but a manpower shortage means his complaints are given a low priority at Sun Hill. TDC Brandon Kane tells Danny Glaze that Tina Pope has lodged a complaint against him, while Chandler makes a confession to old friend DI Alex Cullen - who responds by delivering a stern ultimatum. Lewis Collins guests

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Will Kat give in to Trevor in order to protect Little Mo?

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Will the Slaters swallow their pride and say farewell to Zoe and Anthony? Phil has an ultimatum for Lisa

programme.title: Howards' Way
programme.desc: Charles invites Avril to spend the weekend with him at his chateau, and Leo tries to clear his father's bad name

programme.title: Pie in the Sky
programme.desc: Armed raiders rob wealthy guests at the restaurant, leaving Crabbe no option but to shut up shop. To make matters worse, hotshot DS Stringer is put in charge of the case, and soon finds himself unpopular with the staff by insulting Margaret and victimising Gary. Starring Richard Griffiths and Samantha Janus

programme.title: Peak Practice
programme.desc: The three doctors fall out when a consultant refuses to operate on their heart patient because he is a heavy smoker. Jack is unhappy because Beth has rejected his proposal and Will's marriage suffers another setback. Medical drama, starring Kevin Whately and Amanda Burton

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Sandy falls out with her boyfriend, and Alistair tries to woo the elusive Judith, giving Jean the perfect chance to leap in with her infallible romantic advice - while the more sceptical Lionel stays well out of the way

programme.title: Are You Being Served?
programme.desc: Mr Grace offers the staff accommodation on the premises when their difficult journeys to work lead to demands for a travel allowance, but they soon find flat-sharing is not as easy as it seemed. Vintage comedy, starring John Inman and Mollie Sugden

programme.title: To the Manor Born
programme.desc: DeVere moves his multinational grocery business to the manor and clashes with Audrey over the removal of a fireplace that he considers ugly and she believes is intrinsic to the property. Comedy, starring Penelope Keith and Peter Bowles

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Foggy persuades Clegg and Compo that starting a dog-walking business will be no work at all since they are already going on daily countryside rambles. However, the experience proves to be more of a workout than the trio envisage. Brian Wilde, Peter Sallis and Bill Owen star

programme.title: Dalziel & Pascoe
programme.desc: The duo are called in to find the murderer of an eight-year-old girl, a case which dredges up disturbing memories for Dalziel, who investigated a similar incident in the same area 15 years earlier. The townsfolk are sure a missing local man is guilty of both crimes, but new evidence soon points toward a more complex solution. Feature-length detective drama, starring Warren Clarke, Colin Buchanan, Joanna David, Ronald Pickup and Kaye Wragg

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The team reopen a 1992 abduction case when the woman who disappeared turns up alive and well, claiming she was never kidnapped in the first place. programme.title: Clocking Off
programme.desc: Nick, Kev, Ade and Barney get involved in a fight during a boozy night on the town, but one of them is carrying a weapon and is not afraid to use it, leaving their assailants' ringleader in a critical condition in hospital. programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Joe Crowley and Steve Brown head to the North Yorkshire coast and the beautiful village of Staithes to find out how the traditional fishing community is adapting for the future. Where once there was a fishing fleet of 80, now there is just one fishermen left. Joe also goes out to sea to discover how one skipper has swapped nets for wildlife tourism, while Steve takes a look at Staithes' art heritage and tastes some locally-smoked goodies. Adam Henson finds out about the challenges facing a sheep dairy and Charlotte Smith investigates the latest developments behind one of Britain's biggest ecological marine disasters

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: The Roadshow travels to Portchester Castle in Hampshire, where treasures include an extraordinary set of RAF medals, awarded for extreme bravery to an airman who served in Dunkirk and the Battle of Britain. The team also admires some rare punk clothing by fashion designer Vivienne Westwood and a roll of ornate Arts and Crafts wallpaper destined for the bonfire. Amin Jaffer appraises two valuable paintings by prominent 20th-century Indian artists, Jamini Roy and KH Ara, and explains how each man expressed ideas of Indian identity and nationhood in their works

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Everyone is looking forward to Trixie and Matthew's wedding and a bonny baby competition brings the community together. It's not all good news, however, as the team learn about a pregnant woman and her family living in a cramped caravan, while a worrying disease outbreak directly impacts the residents of Nonnatus House

programme.title: The Gold
programme.desc: Crime drama inspired by the true story of the 1983 Brink's-Mat gold robbery, telling the story from the point of view of both the police and the criminals. When £26million worth of gold is stolen from the Brink's-Mat security depot near Heathrow Airport, long-serving DCI Brian Boyce arrives from counter-terrorism and sets up a task force to investigate. Meanwhile, robbery ringleader Micky McAvoy tries to dispose of the bullion. Starring Hugh Bonneville, Dominic Cooper and Charlotte Spencer

programme.title: Match of the Day 2
programme.desc: Mark Chapman reviews the day's Premier League action, featuring Leeds United v Manchester United at Elland Road and Manchester City v Aston Villa at the Etihad Stadium. City were looking to maintain the pressure on Arsenal at the top of the table, while the two Uniteds met for the second time in five days. Plus, a round-up of yesterday's goals

programme.title: The Women's Football Show
programme.desc: Highlights of the weekend's games in the Super League, including Manchester City v Arsenal and Tottenham Hotspur v Manchester United

programme.title: Before I Go to Sleep (2014)
programme.desc: A woman who cannot retain her memories following a traumatic accident is contacted by a mysterious neuropsychologist, who offers to help her recover the truth about her condition. As she tries to piece together the events of her past, she begins to fear neither her husband nor the doctor are who they seem to be. Thriller, starring Nicole Kidman, Colin Firth and Mark Strong

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Kym Marsh and Gethin Jones host the weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical chat and expert advice

programme.title: 24/7 Pet Hospital
programme.desc: A greyhound is brought in to give blood for the 15th time, meaning he has helped save the lives of around 60 other pets. Other patients include a St Bernard-cross that has broken its leg on a walk and a cockapoo in after being sick for an hour.

programme.title: Claimed and Shamed
programme.desc: A dad who made a £1.5million insurance claim after being seriously injured in an accident at a theme park - only for surveillance to prove he was taking everyone for a ride. Plus, a couple who made a dodgy claim after being hit by a shop sign

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Jacqui Joseph visits Broadstairs, Kent, a favoured holiday destination of Charles Dickens to see a two-bedroom basement garden flat bought by an experienced developer. Martin Roberts is in Burton-on-Trent, Staffordshire, where he sees a fire-damaged two-bed mid-terrace he first saw back in 2021. He's also in Tonypandy, south Wales, to visit a four-storey building with potential to convert into separate flats. All three properties are then sold at auction and the successful bidders share their ambitions for their new acquisitions

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Charlie Ross presents the show from Shepton Mallet in Somerset, where Colin Young and Kate Bliss help the teams scour the stalls for the most profitable items to take to auction. Charlie also meets a man who has assembled one of the largest collections of Star Wars toys in the UK

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Rob struggles to adjust to living with Scarlett, Emma challenges Luca to cook a meal and Bear is caught between two old friends in the middle of a marriage breakdown

programme.title: The Farmers' Country Showdown
programme.desc: For Sharon and Andrew, showing their Coloured Ryeland sheep at the Mid Devon Show is a family affair. Gillian and Ian have brought theirs too, with tears as the results roll in

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Alistair Appleton joins forces with a spiritual businesswoman and her best friend to help find a calming Hampshire home on a budget of £950,000. Taking a breather from the property search, Alistair takes a very deep breath when he experiences the giddy heights of Portsmouth's Spinnaker Tower

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Margie Cooper and Ochuko Ojiri head to north-west England, where items include a 1940s fairground collectable and a silver egg cup with a royal connection

programme.title: Bridge of Lies
programme.desc: Friends Matt, Michael, Ruairi and Andy compete for cash by crossing a bridge of stepping stones across the studio floor. Quiz show, hosted by Ross Kemp

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong, with co-host Alex Brooker

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Jermaine Jenas present the first visit of the week to the One Show studio, featuring the usual mix of topical stories and celebrity chat

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Whitney and Stacey argue when Lily starts to ask questions about her dad. Jack arranges a family lunch at Walford East but it soon goes south when he learns that Nugget is responsible for the bullying Ricky and Lily are facing at school. Phil's guilty conscience leads him to helping Billy find a job and Chelsea hatches a plan to help Keanu

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: Every year, scammers steal billions from the public and fraud now represents around 40 per cent of all reported crime in the UK. Over the past year, Panorama has had access to Kent Police as their detectives try to catch the fraudsters. With more than 10,000 reports of fraud in the county last year, they estimate that only around 20 cases were solved. The report explores why so few cases are prosecuted and shows how fraudsters target the vulnerable, often using sophisticated techniques to dupe victims into handing over their cash

programme.title: Scarlett's Driving School
programme.desc: Documentary in which reality star and TV presenter Scarlett Moffatt sets out to finally pass her driving test - on the 14th attempt - and also helps other luckless would-be drivers who, like her, have been learning for decades. First up is 25-year-old Jess, who has clocked up hundreds of hours of lessons over eight years. Some instructors will no longer get in a car with her, so stepdad Richard is her last chance as she tackles the five-day course at Scarlett's driving school

programme.title: Better
programme.desc: After her son almost dies, corrupt detective Lou Slack attempts to make amends for her misdeeds but realises she must betray the dangerous drug baron she has been working for. Drama, starring Leila Farzad, Andrew Buchan and Samuel Edward-Cook

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Planet Sex with Cara Delevingne
programme.desc: Cara visits a zoo in Santa Barbara to see what the animal kingdom can teach about monogamy and relationships, and takes a brain scan in the USA to reveal the secret science of love. She also takes a DNA test in London which looks at how gene variations may shape our love lives, alongside our upbringings and society, and ponders whether the solution to her relationship quandaries lies in polyamory

programme.title: Planet Sex with Cara Delevingne
programme.desc: Cara explores the meaning of beauty in the 21st century. She meets fellow model and activist Nyakim Gatwech to talk about the lack of diversity in the fashion industry and whether this is shifting in the right direction. She also takes part in a test looking at how the culture a person grow up in impacts who they find attractive and why

programme.title: The Graham Norton Show
programme.desc: Mexican star Salma Hayek Pinault promotes new comedy-drama Magic Mike's Last Dance and Oscar-winner Julianne Moore discusses her part in psychological thriller Sharper. Dancer Johannes Radebe talks about his new touring show, and there are appearances from singer-songwriters Shania Twain and Lizzo. Plus, music by Tom Grennan

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: Victoria Coren Mitchell is guest host of this extended episode, with comedian Ria Lina and Sunday Times journalist Tim Shipman joining team captains Paul Merton and Ian Hislop

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Sam Quek and Gethin Jones host the weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical chat and expert advice

programme.title: 24/7 Pet Hospital
programme.desc: Bear the Pomeranian comes in with a broken leg, luckily surgeon Laura fits a tiny metal plate to fix the bones. Colin the Basset Hound comes for a check up after several bouts of pneumonia and Esme the cat is rushed into the ICU after being brought in for excessive vomiting when the vets are worried about her breathing

programme.title: Claimed and Shamed
programme.desc: A criminal who ran a £250,000 insurance racket is put back behind bars and a woman claiming for an injury cause by a faulty shoe is tripped up by her own evidence. A couple who put in a £30,000 injury claim are caught in a lie when their story doesn't add up and a wedding photographer's phoney claim for a ruined camera kit is exposed. A traveller who has a puncture on the way to the airport misses his flight but his claim falls flat when he submits a forged receipt for his new tyres. Presented by Naga Munchetty

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts and the team explore a holiday flat on the Ayrshire coast bought by reconnected childhood sweethearts, and properties in Wetherby and Windsor

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Christina Trevanion presents the show from Narbeth, South Wales, and learns about the 17th-century Welsh tradition of carving lovespoons. With experts Philip Serrell and Kate Bliss

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Daniel and Zara throw Joe a birthday party and Ruhma and Scarlett are confused by Kirsty's living arrangements. Sid clashes with an Agency Nurse in a number of unexpected ways

programme.title: The Farmers' Country Showdown
programme.desc: Free-range pig farming couple SJ and Nat, along with organic cattle farmers Emma and Ian, try to sell their home-grown food at the Lancashire Game and Country Festival

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Nicki Chapman is in Somerset and Dorset with a buyer from London, and also visits the town of Frome to learn how a fridge is helping to bring the local community together

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Margie and Ochuko visit Staffordshire on their hunt for antique treasures. A brass luggage rack from a railway carriage catches Margie's eye, she's expecting big bids on auction day. She's also charmed by an Edwardian spaniel that forces her to part with £30. Ochuko buys some antique dumbells and an enamel sign hoping for good fortune at auction but it's the little French birdcage he thinks will fly at auction

programme.title: Bridge of Lies
programme.desc: Fiona, Nick, Amy and Laura compete for cash by crossing a bridge of stepping stones across the studio floor. Quiz show, hosted by Ross Kemp

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Alex Brooker

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Alex Scott present another mix of nationwide reports and live studio-based chat

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Whitney tries to tell Stacey what she has done but when they find out the van has been broken in to everything gets worse. Sharon helps Linda prepare for the party at The Vic as she struggles on her first Valentine's Day without Mick. Amy saves the day when Jack forgets the date but will it be enough for Denise?

programme.title: Waterloo Road
programme.desc: Everyone is excited for the end of term show and Danny has some good news to celebrate but the joy is short-lived when the past catches up with him, leading him to make a choice that could change the course of his life for ever. Drama, starring Angela Griffin, with Kym Marsh

programme.title: Ambulance
programme.desc: Filmed in the autumn of 2019, cameras follow a new cast of characters from the London Ambulance Service as they care for the nine million people of the city. In the first episode, ambulance crew members Kate and Femi are dispatched to a young man who is struggling to breathe during a severe anxiety attack. Meanwhile, just three hours into the morning shift, control deal with the third assault of the day, having already responded to four stabbings

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Bad Education
programme.desc: Stephen is desperate to get rid of Mitchell who has moved in after his girlfriend threw him out, so Class K and Stephen set out to transform Mitchell in the hope she'll take him back

programme.title: Wagspiracy: Vardy v Rooney
programme.desc: With access to key individuals who didn't give evidence at the trial, this documentary explores the hidden workings of the tabloids, PRs and agents connected to so-called 'Wagatha Christie', which followed accuisations between footballers' wives Coleen Rooney and Rebekah Vardy. Contributors include Colin Paterson and Lizzie Cundy

programme.title: The Apprentice
programme.desc: The remaining candidates jet off to the cosmopolitan city of Dubai to put on a corporate away day for two international clients based there. While one team show soff the glitz and glam of the location, the other goes for a more traditional approach in the desert. The team with the greater profit at the end wins and back on home soil it's the end of the road for another participant as Lord Sugar wields his axe

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Sean Fletcher explores the legacy of Cornwall's tin and copper mining industry, including the story of an endangered species that has taken to living in disused mine shafts. Adam Henson goes in search of a super fertiliser hidden deep under the North York Moors and Tom Heap finds out if mining Cornish lithium could herald a new gold rush

programme.title: Life in a Cottage Garden with Carol Klein
programme.desc: In July and August, the horticulturist deadheads the roses and stakes plants to help keep the garden looking its best during the summer months, and savours the full blooms of geraniums and lilies. She creates colourful borders using cannas, ginger and dahlias, before visiting her local beach, Braunton Burrows, to seek out native sea holly, which she hopes to grow herself

programme.title: Weatherman Walking: The Welsh Coast
programme.desc: Derek Brockway walks from Abersoch to Pwllheli on the Llyn Peninsula, finding some calming beach yoga a good antidote to a testing cliff climb. Derek discovers hoof-prints made in a prehistoric forest millions of years ago, but only recently revealed in shifting sands and stops off at a special retirement village where a little bit of Poland has been recreated in north Wales

programme.title: Around the World in 80 Gardens
programme.desc: Armed with a long-standing interest in Zen Buddhism, Monty Don takes his globe-trotting tour to the Orient, where he investigates two very different approaches to gardening in China and Japan. His research leads him first to China's ancient scholars' gardens in Suzhou, and after gaining a new insight into oriental horticulture, he journeys to Kyoto, the Japanese city of gardens

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Best Bites
programme.desc: Matt Tebbutt presents highlights from throughout the series, offering viewers a chance to revisit some of their favourite moments from previous years in the kitchen

programme.title: Tom Kerridge's Fresh Start
programme.desc: As the chef's experiment draws to a close, he discovers if the families are healthier and happier than they were when they started the challenge 12 weeks ago. To celebrate their achievements, the families come together to take on Tom's final challenge - learning how to cook generous, health-conscious dishes for groups of friends and family

programme.title: The Best Dishes Ever
programme.desc: Ainsley Harriott introduces a selection of recipes to keep children happy, including Paul Hollywood's sausage rolls, James Martin's banana split and Lorraine Pascale's pizza recipe

programme.title: Odette (1950)
programme.desc: The French widow of an English soldier offers her services to British Intelligence, and is sent undercover as a spy in Nazi-occupied France. However, her work alongside the resistance leads to her falling into the clutches of the Gestapo. Fact-based Second World War drama, with Anna Neagle, Trevor Howard, Peter Ustinov and Marius Goring

programme.title: Operation Crossbow (1965)
programme.desc: Three Allied engineers parachute into occupied Holland on a mission to infiltrate and destroy a German missile base. The trio team up with the local resistance, but two of the men are unaware the third is a Nazi agent. Second World War adventure, starring George Peppard, Sophia Loren, Trevor Howard, Tom Courtenay and John Mills

programme.title: Amanda & Alan's Italian Job
programme.desc: Amanda Holden aims to bring a slice of Hollywood to Sicily with a banana leaf-patterned boudoir as she takes the reins designing the master bedroom. Alan Carr is concerned her camp theme is on the wrong side of tacky, so she takes him to visit one of Palermo's most prestigious hotels to show how exuberant décor has enticed high-profile guests including famous composer Richard Wagner. To bring her vision to life, Amanda ropes in her DIY-loving father to help build a bespoke four-poster bed. Alan, meanwhile, learns to kick back like the Italians do, with a lesson in the art of doing nothing

programme.title: Italy's Invisible Cities
programme.desc: Using the latest 3D scanning technology, Alexander Armstrong and Dr Michael Scott uncover the hidden history of three Italian cities, beginning with Naples, from its earliest Greek and Roman origins. The pair explore the impact of the volcano of Mount Vesuvius, and how it both nurtured the region and exacted a terrible price on the local population. Alexander and Michael also delve into a labyrinth of underground spaces constructed by ruling Bourbon kings in the 19th century, that helped to sustain the city

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: Members of the public bring their antiques and collectibles along to Europe's largest naval aviation museum in Newcastle upon Tyne, where experts Anita Manning and Nick Davies share their knowledge of what everything is worth. Plus, Paul Martin finds our what the people of Tyneside make of Antony Gormley's Angel of the North sculpture

programme.title: Six Nations Highlights
programme.desc: Ugo Monye presents action from the second round of fixtures, featuring Ireland v France at Aviva Stadium, Scotland v Wales at BT Murrayfield and England v Italy at Twickenham. Ireland were looking to end a run of three successive defeats at the hands of the French, while Warren Gatland will have hoped to inspire his side to another win in Scotland, and England will have expected to maintain their unbeaten record against the Azzurri

programme.title: Ski Sunday
programme.desc: Action from the Alpine World Championships in France, featuring the men's and women's downhill event. After the racing, British former slopestyle world champion James Woods goes off grid in the Austrian wilderness as he explores a life on snow away from competition

programme.title: Digging for Britain
programme.desc: In Scotland and northern England, Alice Roberts investigates an Ice Age camp, a mysterious medieval skeleton and the earliest evidence of salt making in Britain

programme.title: The Warship: Tour of Duty
programme.desc: HMS Queen Elizabeth continues her journey to the South China Sea, but rampant Covid on board means she is not allowed to come ashore for any of the planned port visits. Sailing past Singapore and Hong Kong, the ship has become a floating prison, isolated on the high seas. Her dedicated supply ships do their best to keep the Queen Elizabeth topped up with food, fuel and ammunition. As the QE and her escorting destroyers and frigates enter the contested and potentially dangerous waters of the South China Sea, the Chinese Navy react by probing her with submarines and surface warships. Anti-submarine helicopters launch continually in order to identify, track and see off the subsurface threat

programme.title: Kursk: The Last Mission (2018)
programme.desc: Explosions aboard a Russian submarine cause it to sink during a naval exercise in the Barents Sea, leaving 23 survivors trapped on the ocean floor. For the next seven days, members of a rescue team frantically work to reach the men before their dwindling oxygen supply runs out. Fact-based drama, starring Matthias Schoenaerts, Léa Seydoux and Colin Firth

programme.title: The Man Who Knew Infinity (2015)
programme.desc: The story of the life and academic career of the pioneering Indian mathematician, Srinivasa Ramanujan, and his friendship with his mentor at Trinity College, Cambridge, Professor GH Hardy. Biographical drama, starring Jeremy Irons, Dev Patel and Malcolm Sinclair

programme.title: Question Time
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the topical debate, inviting a panel of politicians and other guests to answer questions from an invited audience on subjects that have made the headlines over the past week

programme.title: Waterloo Road
programme.desc: A list ranking female students causes chaos throughout the school and Samia takes matters into her own hands to find the source, but when she finds out Kelly Jo is keeping things from her they start to fall apart. Danny gets a call from his mum and Preston finds himself seeking emotional support in unexpected places at Kai's party

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Eric Knowles presents from Newark Showground in Nottinghamshire, where experts Izzie Balmer and Nick Hall are on hand to try to steer the competing teams to a profit at auction. Eric also visits Bestwood Winding Engine House, which used to be one of the busiest collieries in the county

programme.title: Bridge of Lies
programme.desc: Balaji, Anjali, Bala and Ajit compete for cash by crossing a bridge of stepping stones across the studio floor. Quiz show, hosted by Ross Kemp

programme.title: Winterwatch
programme.desc: Chris Packham and Michaela Strachan revel in some of winter's most dazzling displays. Wild Ken Hill in Norfolk delivers all the live wildlife action from the remote cameras, and there is an insight into some of Britain's smallest mammals. Viewers also meet artist Paul Harfleet, who uses art to engage his audience and highlight the plight of many of our British bird species

programme.title: BBC News at 9
programme.desc: The latest headlines, breaking news and sport from the BBC newsroom.

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international stories as they break

programme.title: Hardball
programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Ore Oduba in which contestants have to answer questions to get as far along a track as they can before a ball catches and passes them, ending their go

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize

programme.title: Britain in Bloom
programme.desc: Chris Bavin helps volunteers in Tewkesbury, Gloucestershire, who are hoping that their flood-prone town does not suffer another inundation before the judging commences

programme.title: Murder, Mystery and My Family: Case Closed?
programme.desc: Barristers Jeremy Dein and Sasha Wass revisit cases previously featured to check on the progress of the investigations, beginning with the case of a wealthy female tenant poisoned by her landlord following a financial deal made shortly before her death in 1911

programme.title: Earth's Greatest Spectacles
programme.desc: The north-eastern region of the United States, known as New England, is the stage for one of the most incredible colour changes on the planet when the vivid greens of summer give way to the golds and reds of autumn. This film reveals how this vibrant fiesta is created by the battles between the trees and the forests inhabitants. Moose, chipmunks, rattlesnakes and a bizarre mixture of caterpillars all play a crucial role; but surprisingly the forest itself was made to be so colourful, thanks to a combination of hard work by beavers, ants and humans. Narrated by Domhnall Gleeson

programme.title: Coast and Country Auctions
programme.desc: A visit to Spalding Plant and Vegetable Auction in Lincolnshire, where as many as 1,000 bags and boxes of vegetables and up to 16,000 plants, shrubs and trees can be sold in a day

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: In Blackburn, Anita Manning values a gold charm bracelet and Philip Serrell takes a shine to an unusual globe. Paul Martin finds out about the life of singer Kathleen Ferrier

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Marcus Brigstocke, Anna Richardson, Tom Rosenthal and Sindhu Vee go toe-to-toe testing their general knowledge skills in a variety of trivia-based games across the week

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: The chef returns to champion more of the food, history and culture of the county. He begins by foraging for mussels in his favourite rock pools, and touring Bodmin Moor's dark past with his son Jack. He also cooks a fool-proof souffle with artisan Cornish goat's cheese

programme.title: Nadiya's Fast Flavours
programme.desc: Nadiya Hussain turns her attention to special occasions. She starts with her lemon drizzle swirls. A twist on the cinnamon bun, these fluffy lemon-and cardamom-scented creations are topped with a pillowy citrus frosting. Next, Nadiya rustles up an earthy chicken stew, featuring 30 cloves of garlic. There's also a roast leg of lamb with jewelled couscous, pomegranate seeds, preserved lemons and pine nuts

programme.title: Mastermind
programme.desc: The hunt for the nation's Mastermind continues as Clive Myrie tests four more contenders on their specialist subjects and general knowledge under the glare of the spotlight and the ticking clock. Tonight's subjects are U2, toy dog breeds, the Mitford sisters and guest stars in 'Friends'

programme.title: Only Connect
programme.desc: The Cunning Planners and Crustaceans battle for a semi-final place, trying to make connections between things that initially do not appear to be linked. Victoria Coren Mitchell presents

programme.title: University Challenge
programme.desc: The second round of the student quiz concludes, with two more teams of four pitting their wits against one another as they attempt to secure a place in the quarter-finals. Jeremy Paxman asks the questions

programme.title: Putin vs the West
programme.desc: Putin intensifies his aggression toward the West, from the Salisbury poisonings to clashes with Donald Trump over nuclear missiles, and fiery rhetoric aimed at NATO, concluding with the moment he launches his invasion of Ukraine. The Head of the CIA, Bill Burns, recounts his secret mission to Moscow to deliver a stark warning to Putin that US Intelligence was on to his plan to invade, while NATO Secretary General Jens Stoltenberg tells of the last-ditch diplomatic efforts to avert war

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Sandi Toksvig looks at tubes and tubas in a totally tubular show, with panellists Alan Davies, Sara Pascoe, Bridget Christie and Deborah Frances-White

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, with Kirsty Wark

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Ordinary Love (2019)
programme.desc: When loving wife Joan feels a lump in her breast, she and husband Tom attempt to navigate the world of serious illness, including the surgery, radiation and chemotherapy. Lisa Barros D'Sa and Glenn Leyburn's critically acclaimed drama based on a script by playwright Owen McCafferty, starring Lesley Manville, Liam Neeson and Esh Alladi

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Sean Fletcher explores the legacy of Cornwall's tin and copper mining industry, including the story of an endangered species that has taken to living in disused mine shafts. Adam Henson goes in search of a super fertiliser hidden deep under the North York Moors and Tom Heap finds out if mining Cornish lithium could herald a new gold rush

programme.title: Dragons' Den
programme.desc: Entrepreneurs Peter Jones, Deborah Meaden, Touker Suleyman, Sara Davies and Steven Bartlett preside over more business opportunities. Among those making pitches are a Welsh fashion designer with a selection of handbags made from fish skin and an 18-year-old hoping to make a mint with his personalised bank card business. Also appearing are two neighbours aiming to save the high street pitch their shop local app, and the inventor of an alarm system that tackles van crime before the damage has already been done. Presented by Evan Davis

programme.title: Make It at Market
programme.desc: After worrying her autism would stop her developing her skills, Belinda has become a talented glassblower with the potential to turn her art into a money-making business. Paul and Becky have a passion for upcycling furniture and are hoping to turn their hobby into a day job. Dom Chinea and his team of experts meets all three makers and helps them to make their aspirations a reality

programme.title: Bridge of Lies
programme.desc: Friends Matt, Michael, Ruairi and Andy compete for cash by crossing a bridge of stepping stones across the studio floor. Quiz show, hosted by Ross Kemp

programme.title: The Hairy Bikers Go Local
programme.desc: Dave Myers and Si King explore Fife, on Scotland's east coast, and visit the Harbour Cafe. Amy is the chef who runs this place alongside husband Jack. The couple insist on using only local, seasonal produce, and fish fresh from the sea just yards from their front door. In April, they literally build the place up, and as the summer season ends, they take it down again. As the building is a temporary structure, there's no mains power, so Amy relies on a charcoal oven

programme.title: Britain in Bloom
programme.desc: In Stechford, Birmingham, Chris Bavin meets a group of determined volunteers entering their town into 'It's Your Neighbourhood', the entry level scheme of Bloom

programme.title: Murder, Mystery and My Family: Case Closed?
programme.desc: Barristers Jeremy Dein and Sasha Wass look back at their oldest case yet, the 1839 murder by drowning of a female passenger aboard a commercial narrow boat in Staffordshire

programme.title: Earth's Greatest Spectacles
programme.desc: Svalbard in the Arctic spends many months of the year in complete darkness, an unrelenting frozen winter with temperatures down to minus 40C. However, as this documentary reveals when the sun finally reappears, the landscape magically transforms from an ice world into a rich tundra, full of exotic plants, birds, arctic foxes, polar bears, walrus and reindeer. This transformation is only possible thanks to some bizarre micro-organisms that feed on ice and the stunning abilities of migrating birds. Narrated by Domhnall Gleeson

programme.title: Coast and Country Auctions
programme.desc: A visit to the Bala Autumn Sale in Snowdonia, north Wales, which is one of the UK's most important sheep dog auctions. Narrated by Stephen Tompkinson

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: Charles Hanson and Philip Serrell hunt for objects to take to auction at Blackburn Cathedral, Lancashire. Charles values a wooden Fijian club, while two vintage enamel signs catch Philip's eye. Presenter Paul Martin takes a look at the impressive Talbot collection - local press photographs taken of events, celebrities and the royal family over a 50-year period

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Marcus Brigstocke, Anna Richardson, Tom Rosenthal and Sindhu Vee go toe-to-toe testing their general knowledge skills in a variety of trivia-based games across the week

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: Rick makes heritage cider with Raynor Winn, author of The Salt Path, and cooks chicken, leek and cider gratin for his friend John Harris, the head gardener at Tresillian House, who regales Rick with his memories of cider-making as a boy. The chef also meets a sea shanty group with a difference

programme.title: Inside the Factory
programme.desc: Malt loaf has been a popular teatime treat for more than 80 years. Consumers get through a staggering 130 million of them every year. So to get to grips with how this sweet cake cum bread is made, Gregg Wallace rolls up his sleeves to follow a production line of massive dough mixing, mind-boggling tin filling and intensely hot baking

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Chefs from Wales serve up their canapes, starters and fish dishes on an animation and illustration theme. They include a lasagne inspired by Fireman Sam, a mushroom pastry based on Quentin Blake's illustrations of The Twits and a Pokemon rice pokeball with monkfish

programme.title: Inside Our Autistic Minds
programme.desc: Since sharing his own autism diagnosis with the world, naturalist and presenter Chris Packham has been flooded with messages from other autistic people, frustrated that their friends, families and colleagues don't understand them. In the first of two programmes, Chris sets out to bridge the gap, helping a group of people on the autism spectrum create short films that reveal to their family and friends what is really going on inside their minds. They include comedian Flo from Wiltshire and 20-year-old student Murray from Oxfordshire - the son of Radio 2 DJ Ken Bruce

programme.title: Detectorists
programme.desc: The police investigate a huge hole that has been excavated, and Larry Bishop's invisible dogs have disappeared. Meanwhile, Andy and Lance have one last chance to pursue their hearts' desires. Comedy, starring Mackenzie Crook and Toby Jones

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events presented by Kirsty Wark

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Dark Waters (2019)
programme.desc: When a defence attorney takes on a lawsuit case against a chemical company, he finds a deep and rich trial in their history that unravels a history of pollution. Drama, starring Mark Ruffalo, Anne Hathaway, Tim Robbins, Bill Pullman and Bill Camp

programme.title: Tokyo Vice
programme.desc: Tozawa attends an yakuza peace summit and learns he is not above humiliation. Jake acts on an unexpected tip from Ishida

programme.title: Surgeons: At the Edge of Life
programme.desc: The team operate on a father of three to remove tumours growing in his neck, including one dangerously close to the spinal cord. It's a high-risk operation - but if the tumours are not removed they could eventually cause paralysis. Also going under the knife is a 19-year-old who has a cancerous mass growing off the largest vein in his body

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Come Dancing
programme.desc: Terry Wogan presents the final of the 1979 amateur dance contest, between North West and Midlands and West, at the Guildhall, Southampton. Ray Moore provides the commentary

programme.title: Chamber Music at the BBC
programme.desc: Petroc Trelawny delves into the BBC film archive for footage of one of Britain's best-loved classical stars - charismatic French cellist Paul Tortelier, whose regular TV appearances in the 1960s and 1970s made him a household name. The programme includes extracts from his popular series of televised masterclasses, an early performance of Elgar's Cello Concerto, and some intimate family music-making with his wife and children - including his son Yan Pascal

programme.title: New Generation Artists Presents
programme.desc: Georgia Mann presents an intimate showcase of Radio 3 New Generation Artists performing in the Coal Exchange building in Cardiff Bay. In the second of two programmes, German pianist Elisabeth Brauss plays Chopin's Scherzo No 2 in B flat minor, alongside three keyboard sonatas by Domenico Scarlatti. Scottish guitarist Sean Shibe performs a selection of Scottish lute music and Dowland's Fantasia. British soprano Ruby Hughes, who is joined by Indian-American pianist Kunal Lahiry, sings music by Strauss, Purcell and Britten, and the Aris Quartet perform a selection of Ervin Schulhoff's Five Pieces for String Quartet

programme.title: The Wedding
programme.desc: Monologues from guests at a black Scottish wedding, including the thoughts of the groom's closest friend, a bartender and an outcast uncle. Performed by Brian James Leys, Lola Aluko and Bruce Fummey

programme.title: The Wedding
programme.desc: Monologues from guests at a black Scottish wedding, featuring a cultural conundrum, a tense reunion and a motherly message. Performed by Nandi Hudson, Moyo Akandé and Michelle Chantelle Hopewell

programme.title: Byzantium: A Tale of Three Cities
programme.desc: Historian Simon Sebag Montefiore explores modern Istanbul in search of evidence of the last centuries of Christian Constantinople, which produced a golden artistic renaissance. There's also a look at how, after the epic siege of 1453, the Ottomans seized control of the city, which became their imperial capital

programme.title: Michael Palin's New Europe
programme.desc: The intrepid traveller continues his journey around eastern Europe by visiting the Baltic states of Estonia, Latvia and Lithuania. He tells the story of how three tiny nations escaped the oppression of the Soviet Union and reclaimed a culture that was once thought lost. Michael celebrates the pagan festival of Jaani, embarks on a session of fire-walking, and comes to understand why Lithuania is often referred to as 'A Singing Nation'

programme.title: Opera Italia
programme.desc: Antonio Pappano traces Verdi's role in Italian history and culture, travelling to Le Roncole to learn about the composer's childhood amid political turmoil, and discovering the effect this had on his operas in later life. He examines six of Verdi's most famous works, rehearses La Traviata at London's Royal Opera House, and conducts Va Pensiero from Nabucco at an open-air concert in Naples

programme.title: Princess Margaret: The Rebel Royal
programme.desc: Part two of two. Experts analyse the Princess's marriage to Lord Snowdon at the start of the 1960s. At home with celebrities and artists, they're riding the wave of a cultural and sexual revolution that's transforming Britain. The mystique of monarchy is being increasingly undermined by the emergence of a more open and egalitarian society

programme.title: Arctic with Bruce Parry
programme.desc: The adventurer travels to a remote Russian village deep within a forest that stretches for thousands of miles, where people rely on the food they can gather from their surroundings. He then heads to Norway to spend time with the Sami reindeer herders who use snowmobiles, boats and sometimes helicopters to move their animals. His six-month journey through the Arctic concludes with a visit to a scientific community in the Svalbard archipelago, where he learns about the fragility of the ecosystem - before witnessing the aurora borealis, also known as the northern lights

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo heads to Chichester, West Sussex, where he encounters an Edwardian motoring duo patronised by King Edward VII. After a grand tour of their factory, he is treated to some rest and relaxation in one of their finest vehicles. Arriving in the resort of Southsea, Hampshire, Michael heads for the King's Theatre, where he treads the boards in a community production of Lads in the Village. Crossing the Solent, the presenter boards the Island Line to travel along the pier in a 1930s London Underground carriage, then hops on to the Isle of Wight heritage line bound for Wootton

programme.title: The Joy of Painting
programme.desc: American artist Bob Ross offers further advice as he paints another picture. Today he creates a seascape, with crashing waves and a sky made of a mixture of gold, pink and mauve

programme.title: The Impressionists - Painting and Revolution
programme.desc: Waldemar Januszczak focuses on the people depicted in the paintings of the impressionists, examining how Degas strove to record life in the city through contortions in his sculpture and acute angles of perspective in his portrayal of ballet dancers. He also studies Caillebotte's pictures, and the work of Morisot, Bracquemond and Cassatt, three female artists who were embraced by the movement

programme.title: Britain's Lost Masterpieces
programme.desc: In Cardiff Art Gallery, the experts investigate a badly overpainted Madonna. Elsewhere, Dr Bendor Grosvenor travels to Florence to explore the early Renaissance

programme.title: Russia 1985-1999: TraumaZone
programme.desc: Documentary about the collapse of communism and democracy. The group around the president believe a war in Chechnya will save him. However, others want the war to restore the glory of the Russian empire. The Oligarchs seize control of practically everything and in the upside down world gangsters become heroes for defending democracy

programme.title: Russia 1985-1999: TraumaZone
programme.desc: Documentary about the collapse of communism and democracy. The western bankers leave, and the oligarchs take control, searching for a new president - they choose Putin. Russians turn against 'the curse of democracy'

programme.title: The Impressionists - Painting and Revolution
programme.desc: Waldemar Januszczak focuses on the people depicted in the paintings of the impressionists, examining how Degas strove to record life in the city through contortions in his sculpture and acute angles of perspective in his portrayal of ballet dancers. He also studies Caillebotte's pictures, and the work of Morisot, Bracquemond and Cassatt, three female artists who were embraced by the movement

programme.title: Ancient Worlds
programme.desc: Richard Miles travels to Sicily and North Africa to explore the rise of the Roman Republic, from its fratricidal mythical beginnings, to its emergence as a powerful empire. Beginning in a cluster of hill villages, the Romans achieved the domination of the Mediterranean after defeating Carthage, and the historian argues that, as the territorial expansion started and the violence increased, Rome became its own worst enemy

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo heads to Chichester, West Sussex, where he encounters an Edwardian motoring duo patronised by King Edward VII. programme.title: Britain's Lost Masterpieces

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: In Dorset, Michael Portillo visits Brownsea Island, where Robert Baden Powell began the scout movement in the early 20th century. Joining a group of present scouts, the presenter learns to build a bivouac and finds out what it is about scouting that still appeals to boys - and girls - today. In the New Forest, Michael searches out some unsung heroes of the First World War - the ponies who became war horses - and hears their story from a commoner who runs a stable and riding school. Then in Bournemouth, the one-time MP investigates a very British institution - the beach hut

programme.title: The Joy of Painting
programme.desc: Bob Ross paints a scene that shows even a tiny shanty by a pond can be a warm place in the dead of winter

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: After years apart, Lionel is reunited with Jean but takes a bigger interest in her daughter. Each believes they have nothing in common any more. First episode of the comedy about late-blossoming love, with Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer. First broadcast in 1992

programme.title: The Mistress
programme.desc: Luke realises he must fulfil his promise to Maxine and spend a whole weekend with her. Carla Lane comedy, starring Felicity Kendal and Jack Galloway. From 1985

programme.title: A History of Britain by Simon Schama
programme.desc: Binham Priory in Norfolk provides the starting point for a brief history of Catholicism in England during the Reformation, from Henry VIII's initial break with Rome to the beginning of Elizabeth I's reign

programme.title: Storyville
programme.desc: An investigation into a powerful spyware called Pegasus, sold to governments around the world by Israeli company NSO Group, and used on journalists, activists and others, including both the wife and fiancee of Saudi dissident Jamal Khashoggi

programme.title: Ancient Worlds
programme.desc: Richard Miles explores the rise and fall of the Roman empire, which at the height of its power, extended the benefits of its civilisation to a staggering 60 million subjects and citizens, from Hadrian's Wall to the banks of the Euphrates. The archaeologist and historian also learns how the expansion of Christianity filled a gap left by the Roman multi-god belief system, eventually leading to the instalment of Constantine as the first Christian emperor

programme.title: The Magic of Mushrooms
programme.desc: Richard Fortey examines the world of mushrooms in a specially built laboratory with the help of mycologist Patrick Hickey. Together, they reveal the ability of fungi to break down waste and sustain new plant life, keeping the planet alive. Richard also travels across Britain and further afield to reveal their mysterious life cycles and how they have the potential to open new frontiers in science, medicine and technology

programme.desc: Nigel, Benjee Bear and Bailee Bear welcome toddlers Joshua, Inam, Liyana, Maisy, Francis and Arabella, and their grown-ups, to the Toddler Club. The What’s in the Box? game reveals a pair of stripy socks, and when the toddlers and parents open up a bigger box, they discover lots more objects and toys that are inspired by patterns. This theme is explored through play, song and story. Grown-ups are encouraged to take part at home by hiding a safe, toddler-appropriate patterns toy or object inside a recycled box for them to reveal and explore with their toddler. Storytime is all about discovering new words, as Benjee Bear and Bailee Bear draw different patterns at home and outside. From zigzags in the mud to swirls in the bath bubbles, the twins have lots of arty fun! Viewers at home show how they’ve been exploring the patterns theme too. programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Joe Crowley and Steve Brown head to the North Yorkshire coast and the beautiful village of Staithes to find out how the traditional fishing community is adapting for the future. Where once there was a fishing fleet of 80, now there is just one fishermen left. Joe also goes out to sea to discover how one skipper has swapped nets for wildlife tourism, while Steve takes a look at Staithes' art heritage and tastes some locally-smoked goodies. Adam Henson finds out about the challenges facing a sheep dairy and Charlotte Smith investigates the latest developments behind one of Britain's biggest ecological marine disasters

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: The Roadshow travels to Portchester Castle in Hampshire, where treasures include an extraordinary set of RAF medals, awarded for extreme bravery to an airman who served in Dunkirk and the Battle of Britain. The team also admires some rare punk clothing by fashion designer Vivienne Westwood and a roll of ornate Arts and Crafts wallpaper destined for the bonfire. Amin Jaffer appraises two valuable paintings by prominent 20th-century Indian artists, Jamini Roy and KH Ara, and explains how each man expressed ideas of Indian identity and nationhood in their works

programme.title: Call the Midwife

It's not all good news, however, as the team learn about a pregnant woman and her family living in a cramped caravan, while a worrying disease outbreak directly impacts the residents of Nonnatus House

programme.title: The Gold
programme.desc: Crime drama inspired by the true story of the 1983 Brink's-Mat gold robbery, telling the story from the point of view of both the police and the criminals. When £26million worth of gold is stolen from the Brink's-Mat security depot near Heathrow Airport, long-serving DCI Brian Boyce arrives from counter-terrorism and sets up a task force to investigate. Meanwhile, robbery ringleader Micky McAvoy tries to dispose of the bullion. Starring Hugh Bonneville, Dominic Cooper and Charlotte Spencer

programme.desc: Whitney and Stacey argue when Lily starts to ask questions about her dad. Jack arranges a family lunch at Walford East but it soon goes south when he learns that Nugget is responsible for the bullying Ricky and Lily are facing at school. Phil's guilty conscience leads him to helping Billy find a job and Chelsea hatches a plan to help Keanu

programme.title: X-Ray
programme.desc: A report from Llandudno on a home improvement firm with some seriously unhappy customers. Plus, a look at the success of community cinemas

programme.title: Food Fest Wales
programme.desc: Sean Fletcher explores the food festival at Llangollen, where local food experts reveal their passion for their produce. Onkar Singh Purewal discovers how it is possible to grow tea in the Vale of Glamorgan and farmer Meinir Howells reveals just why Welsh lamb is so popular. She also discovers the secrets of an ice cream producer in Swansea

programme.title: Better
programme.desc: After her son almost dies, corrupt detective Lou Slack attempts to make amends for her misdeeds but realises she must betray the dangerous drug baron she has been working for. Drama, starring Leila Farzad, Andrew Buchan and Samuel Edward-Cook

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: Every year, scammers steal billions from the public and fraud now represents around 40 per cent of all reported crime in the UK. Over the past year, Panorama has had access to Kent Police as their detectives try to catch the fraudsters. With more than 10,000 reports of fraud in the county last year, they estimate that only around 20 cases were solved. The report explores why so few cases are prosecuted and shows how fraudsters target the vulnerable, often using sophisticated techniques to dupe victims into handing over their cash

programme.title: Planet Sex with Cara Delevingne
programme.desc: Cara visits a zoo in Santa Barbara to see what the animal kingdom can teach about monogamy and relationships, and takes a brain scan in the USA to reveal the secret science of love. She also takes a DNA test in London which looks at how gene variations may shape our love lives, alongside our upbringings and society, and ponders whether the solution to her relationship quandaries lies in polyamory

programme.title: Planet Sex with Cara Delevingne
programme.desc: Cara explores the meaning of beauty in the 21st century. She meets fellow model and activist Nyakim Gatwech to talk about the lack of diversity in the fashion industry and whether this is shifting in the right direction. She also takes part in a test looking at how the culture a person grow up in impacts who they find attractive and why

programme.title: The Graham Norton Show
programme.desc: Mexican star Salma Hayek Pinault promotes new comedy-drama Magic Mike's Last Dance and Oscar-winner Julianne Moore discusses her part in psychological thriller Sharper. Dancer Johannes Radebe talks about his new touring show, and there are appearances from singer-songwriters Shania Twain and Lizzo. Plus, music by Tom Grennan

programme.title: 24/7 Pet Hospital
programme.desc: A greyhound is brought in to give blood for the 15th time, meaning he has helped save the lives of around 60 other pets. Other patients include a St Bernard-cross that has broken its leg on a walk and a cockapoo in after being sick for an hour.

programme.title: Claimed and Shamed
programme.desc: A criminal who ran a £250,000 insurance racket is put back behind bars and a woman claiming for an injury cause by a faulty shoe is tripped up by her own evidence. A couple who put in a £30,000 injury claim are caught in a lie when their story doesn't add up and a wedding photographer's phoney claim for a ruined camera kit is exposed. A traveller who has a puncture on the way to the airport misses his flight but his claim falls flat when he submits a forged receipt for his new tyres. Presented by Naga Munchetty

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts and the team explore a holiday flat on the Ayrshire coast bought by reconnected childhood sweethearts, and properties in Wetherby and Windsor

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Margie and Ochuko visit Staffordshire on their hunt for antique treasures. A brass luggage rack from a railway carriage catches Margie's eye, she's expecting big bids on auction day. She's also charmed by an Edwardian spaniel that forces her to part with £30. Ochuko buys some antique dumbells and an enamel sign hoping for good fortune at auction but it's the little French birdcage he thinks will fly at auction
