programme.desc: Alex Jones and Alex Scott present another mix of nationwide reports and live studio-based chat

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Whitney tries to tell Stacey what she has done but when they find out the van has been broken in to everything gets worse. Sharon helps Linda prepare for the party at The Vic as she struggles on her first Valentine's Day without Mick. Amy saves the day when Jack forgets the date but will it be enough for Denise?

programme.title: Waterloo Road
programme.desc: Everyone is excited for the end of term show and Danny has some good news to celebrate but the joy is short-lived when the past catches up with him, leading him to make a choice that could change the course of his life for ever. Drama, starring Angela Griffin, with Kym Marsh

programme.title: Ambulance
programme.desc: Filmed in the autumn of 2019, cameras follow a new cast of characters from the London Ambulance Service as they care for the nine million people of the city. In the first episode, ambulance crew members Kate and Femi are dispatched to a young man who is struggling to breathe during a severe anxiety attack. Meanwhile, just three hours into the morning shift, control deal with the third assault of the day, having already responded to four stabbings

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Bad Education
programme.desc: Stephen is desperate to get rid of Mitchell who has moved in after his girlfriend threw him out, so Class K and Stephen set out to transform Mitchell in the hope she'll take him back

programme.title: Wagspiracy: Vardy v Rooney
programme.desc: With access to key individuals who didn't give evidence at the trial, this documentary explores the hidden workings of the tabloids, PRs and agents connected to so-called 'Wagatha Christie', which followed accuisations between footballers' wives Coleen Rooney and Rebekah Vardy. Contributors include Colin Paterson and Lizzie Cundy

programme.title: Dark Waters (2019)
programme.desc: When a defence attorney takes on a lawsuit case against a chemical company, he finds a deep and rich trial in their history that unravels a history of pollution. Drama, starring Mark Ruffalo, Anne Hathaway, Tim Robbins, Bill Pullman and Bill Camp

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: Gary Lineker presents highlights of the latest Premier League matches, including West Ham United v Chelsea at London Stadium and Arsenal v Brentford at Emirates Stadium. The Hammers were looking to avenge a 2-1 defeat at the hands of Chelsea in September, while the title-chasing Gunners will have hoped to emulate their strong display in a 3-0 win over the Bees at Brentford Community Stadium. Plus, Crystal Palace v Brighton & Hove Albion, Fulham v Nottingham Forest, Leicester City v Tottenham Hotspur, Southampton v Wolverhampton Wanderers and Bournemouth v Newcastle United

programme.title: Sunday with Laura Kuenssberg
programme.desc: Interviews with key politicians and public figures

programme.title: The Sunday Show
programme.desc: Martin Geissler presents the main issues from the world of politics and beyond, featuring interviews, discussion and analysis on the stories that matter to Scotland

programme.title: Sunday Morning Live
programme.desc: A discussion on the decision to allow blessings in church for same-sex couples, and a visit to the Welsh island dedicated to love. Hosted by Sean Fletcher and Holly Hamilton

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: The team reports on three sets of developers taking on three very different auction properties in London and Wolverhampton, with hammer prices ranging from just over £100,000 to nearly half a million. Time will tell whether all three investors will deliver stunning renovations

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Natasha Raskin Sharp hosts from Southwell Racecourse in Nottinghamshire, where experts Thomas Forrester and Tim Weeks help competing teams bag the best buys to make a profit at auction. Natasha also investigates a mystery item that dates back to the mid-19th century

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: Songs of Praise
programme.desc: Claire McCollum marks Valentine's Day by discovering the extraordinary 275-year history of love and marriage at Gretna Green, from young lovers eloping in the 18th century through to the 3,000-plus couples who still get married in the tiny border village each year. Claire also meets the parents who made history as the first same-sex couple in Scotland to be approved for adoption

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Sonali Shah showcases a selection of Cotswolds properties to a couple from Essex who are hoping their budget of £550,000 will buy them a new home with three bedrooms, one of which could be used for a home office

programme.title: Chicken Run (2000)
programme.desc: A headstrong chicken and her fellow fowls ponder how to escape from a grim Yorkshire farm before the evil farmer's wife can turn them into pies. Luckily, help arrives in the form of a heroic American rooster who promises to show them how to fly. Nick Park's animated comedy, with the voices of Mel Gibson, Julia Sawalha, Miranda Richardson and Jane Horrocks

programme.title: Young MasterChef
programme.desc: The contestants must work in pairs to dash around the supermarket and cook a feast on a budget of £30. Their dish must be all their own, but they must design a menu in their pairs

programme.title: Young MasterChef
programme.desc: The Young MasterChef final five are back to show judges Poppy and Kerth their sweet side in the form of an ice cream parlour challenge

programme.title: Serengeti
programme.desc: Bakari and the rest of the baboons can see no escape when the lions take over their home - until the pride fall asleep. Baby hippo Mafuta's mother tries to keep the crocodiles from desecrating his dead father's body - but in the ensuing chaos the youngster is swept away down the river. Crocodile Magamba defends her hatchlings and Duma the cheetah struggles to make friends

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Joe Crowley and Steve Brown head to the North Yorkshire coast and the beautiful village of Staithes to find out how the traditional fishing community is adapting for the future. Where once there was a fishing fleet of 80, now there is just one fishermen left. Joe also goes out to sea to discover how one skipper has swapped nets for wildlife tourism, while Steve takes a look at Staithes' art heritage and tastes some locally-smoked goodies. Adam Henson finds out about the challenges facing a sheep dairy and Charlotte Smith investigates the latest developments behind one of Britain's biggest ecological marine disasters

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: The Roadshow travels to Portchester Castle in Hampshire, where treasures include an extraordinary set of RAF medals, awarded for extreme bravery to an airman who served in Dunkirk and the Battle of Britain. The team also admires some rare punk clothing by fashion designer Vivienne Westwood and a roll of ornate Arts and Crafts wallpaper destined for the bonfire. Amin Jaffer appraises two valuable paintings by prominent 20th-century Indian artists, Jamini Roy and KH Ara, and explains how each man expressed ideas of Indian identity and nationhood in their works

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Everyone is looking forward to Trixie and Matthew's wedding and a bonny baby competition brings the community together. It's not all good news, however, as the team learn about a pregnant woman and her family living in a cramped caravan, while a worrying disease outbreak directly impacts the residents of Nonnatus House

programme.title: The Gold
programme.desc: Crime drama inspired by the true story of the 1983 Brink's-Mat gold robbery, telling the story from the point of view of both the police and the criminals. When £26million worth of gold is stolen from the Brink's-Mat security depot near Heathrow Airport, long-serving DCI Brian Boyce arrives from counter-terrorism and sets up a task force to investigate. Meanwhile, robbery ringleader Micky McAvoy tries to dispose of the bullion. Starring Hugh Bonneville, Dominic Cooper and Charlotte Spencer

programme.title: Match of the Day 2
programme.desc: Mark Chapman reviews the day's Premier League action, featuring Leeds United v Manchester United at Elland Road and Manchester City v Aston Villa at the Etihad Stadium. City were looking to maintain the pressure on Arsenal at the top of the table, while the two Uniteds met for the second time in five days. Plus, a round-up of yesterday's goals

programme.title: Sportscene
programme.desc: Rangers v Partick Thistle. Amy Irons presents action from the fifth-round tie at Ibrox. Plus, a round-up of yesterday's goals

programme.title: The Women's Football Show
programme.desc: Highlights of the weekend's games in the Super League, including Manchester City v Arsenal and Tottenham Hotspur v Manchester United

programme.title: Before I Go to Sleep (2014)
programme.desc: A woman who cannot retain her memories following a traumatic accident is contacted by a mysterious neuropsychologist, who offers to help her recover the truth about her condition. As she tries to piece together the events of her past, she begins to fear neither her husband nor the doctor are who they seem to be. Thriller, starring Nicole Kidman, Colin Firth and Mark Strong

programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: 24/7 Pet Hospital
programme.desc: A greyhound is brought in to give blood for the 15th time, meaning he has helped save the lives of around 60 other pets. Other patients include a St Bernard-cross that has broken its leg on a walk and a cockapoo in after being sick for an hour.

programme.title: Claimed and Shamed
programme.desc: A dad who made a £1.5million insurance claim after being seriously injured in an accident at a theme park - only for surveillance to prove he was taking everyone for a ride. Plus, a couple who made a dodgy claim after being hit by a shop sign

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Jacqui Joseph visits Broadstairs, Kent, a favoured holiday destination of Charles Dickens to see a two-bedroom basement garden flat bought by an experienced developer. Martin Roberts is in Burton-on-Trent, Staffordshire, where he sees a fire-damaged two-bed mid-terrace he first saw back in 2021. He's also in Tonypandy, south Wales, to visit a four-storey building with potential to convert into separate flats. All three properties are then sold at auction and the successful bidders share their ambitions for their new acquisitions

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Charlie Ross presents the show from Shepton Mallet in Somerset, where Colin Young and Kate Bliss help the teams scour the stalls for the most profitable items to take to auction. Charlie also meets a man who has assembled one of the largest collections of Star Wars toys in the UK

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Rob struggles to adjust to living with Scarlett, Emma challenges Luca to cook a meal and Bear is caught between two old friends in the middle of a marriage breakdown

programme.title: The Farmers' Country Showdown
programme.desc: For Sharon and Andrew, showing their Coloured Ryeland sheep at the Mid Devon Show is a family affair. Gillian and Ian have brought theirs too, with tears as the results roll in

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Alistair Appleton joins forces with a spiritual businesswoman and her best friend to help find a calming Hampshire home on a budget of £950,000. Taking a breather from the property search, Alistair takes a very deep breath when he experiences the giddy heights of Portsmouth's Spinnaker Tower

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Margie Cooper and Ochuko Ojiri head to north-west England, where items include a 1940s fairground collectable and a silver egg cup with a royal connection

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Joe Crowley and Steve Brown head to the North Yorkshire coast and the beautiful village of Staithes to find out how the traditional fishing community is adapting for the future. Where once there was a fishing fleet of 80, now there is just one fishermen left. Joe also goes out to sea to discover how one skipper has swapped nets for wildlife tourism, while Steve takes a look at Staithes' art heritage and tastes some locally-smoked goodies. Adam Henson finds out about the challenges facing a sheep dairy and Charlotte Smith investigates the latest developments behind one of Britain's biggest ecological marine disasters

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: The Roadshow travels to Portchester Castle in Hampshire, where treasures include an extraordinary set of RAF medals, awarded for extreme bravery to an airman who served in Dunkirk and the Battle of Britain. The team also admires some rare punk clothing by fashion designer Vivienne Westwood and a roll of ornate Arts and Crafts wallpaper destined for the bonfire. Amin Jaffer appraises two valuable paintings by prominent 20th-century Indian artists, Jamini Roy and KH Ara, and explains how each man expressed ideas of Indian identity and nationhood in their works

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Everyone is looking forward to Trixie and Matthew's wedding and a bonny baby competition brings the community together. It's not all good news, however, as the team learn about a pregnant woman and her family living in a cramped caravan, while a worrying disease outbreak directly impacts the residents of Nonnatus House

programme.title: The Gold
programme.desc: Crime drama inspired by the true story of the 1983 Brink's-Mat gold robbery, telling the story from the point of view of both the police and the criminals. When £26million worth of gold is stolen from the Brink's-Mat security depot near Heathrow Airport, long-serving DCI Brian Boyce arrives from counter-terrorism and sets up a task force to investigate. Meanwhile, robbery ringleader Micky McAvoy tries to dispose of the bullion. Starring Hugh Bonneville, Dominic Cooper and Charlotte Spencer

programme.title: Match of the Day 2
programme.desc: Mark Chapman reviews the day's Premier League action, featuring Leeds United v Manchester United at Elland Road and Manchester City v Aston Villa at the Etihad Stadium. City were looking to maintain the pressure on Arsenal at the top of the table, while the two Uniteds met for the second time in five days. Plus, a round-up of yesterday's goals

programme.title: The Women's Football Show
programme.desc: Highlights of the weekend's games in the Super League, including Manchester City v Arsenal and Tottenham Hotspur v Manchester United

programme.title: Before I Go to Sleep (2014)
programme.desc: A woman who cannot retain her memories following a traumatic accident is contacted by a mysterious neuropsychologist, who offers to help her recover the truth about her condition. As she tries to piece together the events of her past, she begins to fear neither her husband nor the doctor are who they seem to be. Thriller, starring Nicole Kidman, Colin Firth and Mark Strong

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Kym Marsh and Gethin Jones host the weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical chat and expert advice

programme.title: 24/7 Pet Hospital
programme.desc: A greyhound is brought in to give blood for the 15th time, meaning he has helped save the lives of around 60 other pets. Other patients include a St Bernard-cross that has broken its leg on a walk and a cockapoo in after being sick for an hour.

programme.title: Claimed and Shamed
programme.desc: A dad who made a £1.5million insurance claim after being seriously injured in an accident at a theme park - only for surveillance to prove he was taking everyone for a ride. Plus, a couple who made a dodgy claim after being hit by a shop sign

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Jacqui Joseph visits Broadstairs, Kent, a favoured holiday destination of Charles Dickens to see a two-bedroom basement garden flat bought by an experienced developer. Martin Roberts is in Burton-on-Trent, Staffordshire, where he sees a fire-damaged two-bed mid-terrace he first saw back in 2021. He's also in Tonypandy, south Wales, to visit a four-storey building with potential to convert into separate flats. All three properties are then sold at auction and the successful bidders share their ambitions for their new acquisitions

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Charlie Ross presents the show from Shepton Mallet in Somerset, where Colin Young and Kate Bliss help the teams scour the stalls for the most profitable items to take to auction. Charlie also meets a man who has assembled one of the largest collections of Star Wars toys in the UK

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Rob struggles to adjust to living with Scarlett, Emma challenges Luca to cook a meal and Bear is caught between two old friends in the middle of a marriage breakdown

programme.title: The Farmers' Country Showdown
programme.desc: For Sharon and Andrew, showing their Coloured Ryeland sheep at the Mid Devon Show is a family affair. Gillian and Ian have brought theirs too, with tears as the results roll in

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Alistair Appleton joins forces with a spiritual businesswoman and her best friend to help find a calming Hampshire home on a budget of £950,000. Taking a breather from the property search, Alistair takes a very deep breath when he experiences the giddy heights of Portsmouth's Spinnaker Tower

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Margie Cooper and Ochuko Ojiri head to north-west England, where items include a 1940s fairground collectable and a silver egg cup with a royal connection

programme.title: Bridge of Lies
programme.desc: Friends Matt, Michael, Ruairi and Andy compete for cash by crossing a bridge of stepping stones across the studio floor. Quiz show, hosted by Ross Kemp

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong, with co-host Alex Brooker

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Jermaine Jenas present the first visit of the week to the One Show studio, featuring the usual mix of topical stories and celebrity chat

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Whitney and Stacey argue when Lily starts to ask questions about her dad. Jack arranges a family lunch at Walford East but it soon goes south when he learns that Nugget is responsible for the bullying Ricky and Lily are facing at school. Phil's guilty conscience leads him to helping Billy find a job and Chelsea hatches a plan to help Keanu

programme.title: The Chronicles of Belfast
programme.desc: As autumn arrives in the city, nature reserve warden Maureen prepares for the arrival of wild ponies, which will stay all winter and graze the undergrowth. Conservationist Aaron builds a pond on the hill, Alannah monitors the river for pollution by looking for small creatures buried in the mud and Clare forages for nuts and berries

programme.title: Food Fest Northern Ireland
programme.desc: Colin Murray and Edith Bowman explore Ballycastle's Ould Lammas Fair, finding out how Venezuelan street food made it to Northern Ireland. They also learn how to make money go further when it comes to meat and Colin introduces Edith to Yellowman and dulce. Ryan Hand is in Armagh on the hunt for a healthy ready meal and chef Suzie Lee finds a delicious fishy surprise in Lough Neagh.

programme.title: Better
programme.desc: After her son almost dies, corrupt detective Lou Slack attempts to make amends for her misdeeds but realises she must betray the dangerous drug baron she has been working for. Drama, starring Leila Farzad, Andrew Buchan and Samuel Edward-Cook

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: Every year, scammers steal billions from the public and fraud now represents around 40 per cent of all reported crime in the UK. Over the past year, Panorama has had access to Kent Police as their detectives try to catch the fraudsters. With more than 10,000 reports of fraud in the county last year, they estimate that only around 20 cases were solved. The report explores why so few cases are prosecuted and shows how fraudsters target the vulnerable, often using sophisticated techniques to dupe victims into handing over their cash

programme.title: Planet Sex with Cara Delevingne
programme.desc: Cara visits a zoo in Santa Barbara to see what the animal kingdom can teach about monogamy and relationships, and takes a brain scan in the USA to reveal the secret science of love. She also takes a DNA test in London which looks at how gene variations may shape our love lives, alongside our upbringings and society, and ponders whether the solution to her relationship quandaries lies in polyamory

programme.title: Planet Sex with Cara Delevingne
programme.desc: Cara explores the meaning of beauty in the 21st century. She meets fellow model and activist Nyakim Gatwech to talk about the lack of diversity in the fashion industry and whether this is shifting in the right direction. She also takes part in a test looking at how the culture a person grow up in impacts who they find attractive and why

programme.title: The Graham Norton Show
programme.desc: Mexican star Salma Hayek Pinault promotes new comedy-drama Magic Mike's Last Dance and Oscar-winner Julianne Moore discusses her part in psychological thriller Sharper. Dancer Johannes Radebe talks about his new touring show, and there are appearances from singer-songwriters Shania Twain and Lizzo. Plus, music by Tom Grennan

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Sam Quek and Gethin Jones host the weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical chat and expert advice

programme.title: 24/7 Pet Hospital
programme.desc: Bear the Pomeranian comes in with a broken leg, luckily surgeon Laura fits a tiny metal plate to fix the bones. Colin the Basset Hound comes for a check up after several bouts of pneumonia and Esme the cat is rushed into the ICU after being brought in for excessive vomiting when the vets are worried about her breathing

programme.title: Claimed and Shamed
programme.desc: A criminal who ran a £250,000 insurance racket is put back behind bars and a woman claiming for an injury cause by a faulty shoe is tripped up by her own evidence. A couple who put in a £30,000 injury claim are caught in a lie when their story doesn't add up and a wedding photographer's phoney claim for a ruined camera kit is exposed. A traveller who has a puncture on the way to the airport misses his flight but his claim falls flat when he submits a forged receipt for his new tyres. Presented by Naga Munchetty

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts and the team explore a holiday flat on the Ayrshire coast bought by reconnected childhood sweethearts, and properties in Wetherby and Windsor

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Christina Trevanion presents the show from Narbeth, South Wales, and learns about the 17th-century Welsh tradition of carving lovespoons. With experts Philip Serrell and Kate Bliss

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Daniel and Zara throw Joe a birthday party and Ruhma and Scarlett are confused by Kirsty's living arrangements. Sid clashes with an Agency Nurse in a number of unexpected ways

programme.title: The Farmers' Country Showdown
programme.desc: Free-range pig farming couple SJ and Nat, along with organic cattle farmers Emma and Ian, try to sell their home-grown food at the Lancashire Game and Country Festival

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Nicki Chapman is in Somerset and Dorset with a buyer from London, and also visits the town of Frome to learn how a fridge is helping to bring the local community together

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Margie and Ochuko visit Staffordshire on their hunt for antique treasures. A brass luggage rack from a railway carriage catches Margie's eye, she's expecting big bids on auction day. She's also charmed by an Edwardian spaniel that forces her to part with £30. Ochuko buys some antique dumbells and an enamel sign hoping for good fortune at auction but it's the little French birdcage he thinks will fly at auction

programme.title: Bridge of Lies
programme.desc: Fiona, Nick, Amy and Laura compete for cash by crossing a bridge of stepping stones across the studio floor. Quiz show, hosted by Ross Kemp

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Alex Brooker

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Alex Scott present another mix of nationwide reports and live studio-based chat

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Whitney tries to tell Stacey what she has done but when they find out the van has been broken in to everything gets worse. Sharon helps Linda prepare for the party at The Vic as she struggles on her first Valentine's Day without Mick. Amy saves the day when Jack forgets the date but will it be enough for Denise?

programme.title: Waterloo Road
programme.desc: Everyone is excited for the end of term show and Danny has some good news to celebrate but the joy is short-lived when the past catches up with him, leading him to make a choice that could change the course of his life for ever. Drama, starring Angela Griffin, with Kym Marsh

programme.title: Ambulance
programme.desc: Filmed in the autumn of 2019, cameras follow a new cast of characters from the London Ambulance Service as they care for the nine million people of the city. In the first episode, ambulance crew members Kate and Femi are dispatched to a young man who is struggling to breathe during a severe anxiety attack. Meanwhile, just three hours into the morning shift, control deal with the third assault of the day, having already responded to four stabbings

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Restoration Rescue
programme.desc: Patrick Bradley meets a couple planning to restore a fisherman's cottage in Lough Neagh. After their friend Phyllis, who was born and lived her whole life in there, passed away. Their sentimental attachment means they want to keep as much of the character as possible but since the fabric of the cottage has seen better day this proves to be a challenge. Patrick takes the couple to the Ulster Folk Museum to learn about what life would have been like for the fishermen who once lived in the cottage and they use science to determine when it was originally built

programme.title: Bad Education
programme.desc: Stephen is desperate to get rid of Mitchell who has moved in after his girlfriend threw him out, so Class K and Stephen set out to transform Mitchell in the hope she'll take him back

programme.title: Wagspiracy: Vardy v Rooney
programme.desc: With access to key individuals who didn't give evidence at the trial, this documentary explores the hidden workings of the tabloids, PRs and agents connected to so-called 'Wagatha Christie', which followed accuisations between footballers' wives Coleen Rooney and Rebekah Vardy. Contributors include Colin Paterson and Lizzie Cundy

programme.title: The Apprentice
programme.desc: The remaining candidates jet off to the cosmopolitan city of Dubai to put on a corporate away day for two international clients based there. While one team show soff the glitz and glam of the location, the other goes for a more traditional approach in the desert. The team with the greater profit at the end wins and back on home soil it's the end of the road for another participant as Lord Sugar wields his axe

programme.title: BBC 100 Women In Conversation
programme.desc: Priyanka Chopra Jonas never dreamt of becoming famous, but then she won the 2000 Miss World pageant, which provided a 'small-town girl' with a springboard for an international career. But she says she was getting paid 10% of her male co-actor's salary while starring in Bollywood movies, and it's been only during her most recent acting engagement in Hollywood that she has seen the gender pay gap closing for her. In an interview with BBC 100 Women's Yogita Limaye, the Indian actress and producer speaks about her experience with pay parity, body shaming and the pressure social media can bring.

programme.title: BBC 100 Women In Conversation
programme.desc: Priyanka Chopra Jonas never dreamt of becoming famous, but then she won the 2000 Miss World pageant, which provided a 'small-town girl' with a springboard for an international career. But she says she was getting paid 10% of her male co-actor's salary while starring in Bollywood movies, and it's been only during her most recent acting engagement in Hollywood that she has seen the gender pay gap closing for her. In an interview with BBC 100 Women's Yogita Limaye, the Indian actress and producer speaks about her experience with pay parity, body shaming and the pressure social media can bring.

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: Every year, scammers steal billions from the public and fraud now represents around 40 per cent of all reported crime in the UK. Over the past year, Panorama has had access to Kent Police as their detectives try to catch the fraudsters. With more than 10,000 reports of fraud in the county last year, they estimate that only around 20 cases were solved. The report explores why so few cases are prosecuted and shows how fraudsters target the vulnerable, often using sophisticated techniques to dupe victims into handing over their cash

programme.title: Lloyd of the Flies
programme.desc: An animated series about a young fly with a lot to prove. programme.title: Lloyd of the Flies
programme.desc: An animated series about a young fly with a lot to prove. The newsstand has a new comic in stock called Llerd the Fly, and Lloyd is appalled to discover that Llerd is based on him! programme.title: Thunderbirds Are Go
programme.desc: The Tracy brothers and their friends at International Rescue set out to foil the nefarious plots of the evil Hood. With the voices of Rosamund Pike, Kayvan Novak and Thomas Brodie-Sangster, with the original Parker - David Graham - returning to voice Lady Penelope's long-serving chauffeur

programme.title: Lloyd of the Flies
programme.desc: An animated series about a young fly with a lot to prove. programme.title: Lloyd of the Flies
programme.desc: An animated series about a young fly with a lot to prove. Everyone knows that there's no such thing as head lice... after all, an insect can't live on a Biggo without getting squashed or swatted! However, when Lloyd meets a real head louse called Titchy, he's torn between proving her existence or returning her to Biggo's head.

programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Six Nations Live
programme.desc: England v Italy (Kick-off 3.00pm). Mark Pougatch presents all the action from the final match in the second round of fixtures, held at Twickenham. England have won all 29 of the previous meetings between the sides, but the Italians did give them a scare here two years ago when they took an early lead thanks to a Monty Ioane try, before the hosts turned things around, scoring six tries in a 41-18 win. However, Italy are seemingly on an upward curve and will be buoyed by a memorable 22-21 win in Cardiff last March and by an impressive 28-27 victory over Australia in November. With analysis from Clive Woodward, Jonny Wilkinson and Lawrence Dallaglio, pitchside reports by Martin Bayfield and Maggie Alphonsi, and commentary from Nick Mullins, Ben Kay and David Flatman

programme.title: You've Been Framed!
programme.desc: Harry Hill narrates another comical selection filmed by viewers, featuring a paraglider landing on a hot barbecue, a toy car bursting into flames and a cat marking its territory on a CCTV camera

programme.title: Dancing on Ice

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: Joel Kingston is a copper's copper from a respected and notable police family, but when he is found dead, floating in a park lake, DCI Vera Stanhope investigates both sides of the thin blue line in order to find his killer. A complex family dynamic, tensions at work, and brushes with the underworld, paint a dark and complex picture. Joel was there to serve and protect but did his stubborn commitment to justice at any price lead to his death? Murder mystery, starring Brenda Blethyn and Kenny Doughty

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Bradley & Barney Walsh: Breaking Dad
programme.desc: The duo continue to explore Costa Rica. Inspired by childhood memories, the pair head to the country's cloud forest, where they attempt tree climbing. They also visit a local sanctuary that is home to 2000 free roaming dogs, before heading into the countryside to meet a former Olympian in Kayak Slalom, where the father and son go head-to-head in a time trial

programme.title: Super Bowl
programme.desc: Philadelphia Eagles v Kansas City Chiefs (Kick-off 11.30pm). Live coverage of this year's showpiece event, which takes place at State Farm Stadium in Glendale, Arizona. The Chiefs are appearing in this contest for the third time in four years, and will hope to emulate their performance from 2019 when they claimed a 31-20 victory over the San Francisco 49ers to lift the Vince Lombardi Trophy. The Eagles claimed their sole Super Bowl victory one year prior to that with a 41-33 win over the New England Patriots, when back-up quarterback Nick Foles famously caught a one-yard touchdown pass on a trick play that later became known as the Philly Special, and entered NFL folklore. Laura Woods presents, with analysis from Osi Umenyiora and Jason Bell

programme.desc: Gabriel Clarke presents a look back at a memorable year for Irish rugby as Joe Schmidt's side secured only the third Grand Slam in Ireland's history. programme.title: Cold Case Forensics
programme.desc: Forensic scientist Dr Angela Gallop and her team detail the methods that helped them crack the 1988 murder of Lynette White in Cardiff. The case had resulted in one of Britain's worst miscarriages of justice, and by 1999 it remained unsolved when a new detective squad brought in Dr Gallop and her forensic team to help solve the case. She and other experts, as well as police officers, lawyers and one of those wrongly accused, tell the story. Nicola Walker narrates

programme.title: Dare Master

programme.title: Lloyd of the Flies
programme.desc: An animated series about a young fly with a lot to prove. Lloyd becomes trapped in the web of Petrichor, a very hungry spider - fortunately, Petrichor is also very chatty, and so Lloyd must rely on his wits to try and talk his way out of their web - or, at least, buy some time so he can be rescued...

programme.title: Lloyd of the Flies
programme.desc: An animated series about a young fly with a lot to prove. The newsstand has a new comic in stock called Llerd the Fly, and Lloyd is appalled to discover that Llerd is based on him! Intent on preventing any more copies of Llerd being produced, Lloyd sets out to uncover the identity of the comic's mysterious author.

programme.title: Thunderbirds Are Go
programme.desc: The Tracy brothers and their friends at International Rescue set out to foil the nefarious plots of the evil Hood. An updated remake of the classic 1960s marionette adventure series, this time featuring computer-animated characters on live-action modeled sets. With the voices of Rosamund Pike, Kayvan Novak and Thomas Brodie-Sangster, with the original Parker - David Graham - returning to voice Lady Penelope's long-serving chauffeur

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mrs. Wicket demands Mr. Bean drive her and Miss Wince to the spa, and wait outside until they're done. But Bean gets bored, and looks for fun!

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Bean is cajoled by Irma and spurred by jealousy of the fund-raising star Declan into raising money for a donkey sanctuary.

programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud
programme.desc: Anna is practising for the school cycling test and is good at it. Dave isn't quite as skilled, but with a new bike from his parents he really hopes to pass.

programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud
programme.desc: George takes the Spuds to the museum of mouldy cheese. Anna dares Dave to lick the cheeses on display.

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Animation following the kindly but accident-prone Mr Magoo. Fizz uses the TransmorgaFizz to give Weasel a more muscular body. But, the invention ends up in Magoo's hands and our hero turns Fizz into a chihuahua.

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Animation following the kindly but accident-prone Mr Magoo. Fizz wants to test out the PrestodigiousFizz - a magic wand - during a magic show, but when he runs into Magoo, he mistakes him for someone else.

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Animation following the kindly but accident-prone Mr Magoo. While Magoo is on a witch hunt, Weasel receives a surprise visit from his bitter, waspy, old-fashioned mother. Fizz and Mrs. Weasel's first encounter is explosive.

programme.title: Lloyd of the Flies
programme.desc: An animated series about a young fly with a lot to prove. Malcolm has a new 'home theatre', a literal small theatre run by a troupe of flea actors - Lloyd 'breaks' it when he offends one of the actors and ends up having to take her place on the road, but will his acting skills be up to the job?

programme.title: Lloyd of the Flies
programme.desc: An animated series about a young fly with a lot to prove. Everyone knows that there's no such thing as head lice... after all, an insect can't live on a Biggo without getting squashed or swatted! However, when Lloyd meets a real head louse called Titchy, he's torn between proving her existence or returning her to Biggo's head.

programme.title: Six Nations Live
programme.desc: England v Italy (Kick-off 3.00pm). Mark Pougatch presents all the action from the final match in the second round of fixtures, held at Twickenham. England have won all 29 of the previous meetings between the sides, but the Italians did give them a scare here two years ago when they took an early lead thanks to a Monty Ioane try, before the hosts turned things around, scoring six tries in a 41-18 win. However, Italy are seemingly on an upward curve and will be buoyed by a memorable 22-21 win in Cardiff last March and by an impressive 28-27 victory over Australia in November. With analysis from Clive Woodward, Jonny Wilkinson and Lawrence Dallaglio, pitchside reports by Martin Bayfield and Maggie Alphonsi, and commentary from Nick Mullins, Ben Kay and David Flatman

programme.title: You've Been Framed!

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: Joel Kingston is a copper's copper from a respected and notable police family, but when he is found dead, floating in a park lake, DCI Vera Stanhope investigates both sides of the thin blue line in order to find his killer. A complex family dynamic, tensions at work, and brushes with the underworld, paint a dark and complex picture. Joel was there to serve and protect but did his stubborn commitment to justice at any price lead to his death? Murder mystery, starring Brenda Blethyn and Kenny Doughty

programme.title: Bradley & Barney Walsh: Breaking Dad
programme.desc: The duo continue to explore Costa Rica. Inspired by childhood memories, the pair head to the country's cloud forest, where they attempt tree climbing. They also visit a local sanctuary that is home to 2000 free roaming dogs, before heading into the countryside to meet a former Olympian in Kayak Slalom, where the father and son go head-to-head in a time trial

programme.title: Super Bowl
programme.desc: Philadelphia Eagles v Kansas City Chiefs (Kick-off 11.30pm). Live coverage of this year's showpiece event, which takes place at State Farm Stadium in Glendale, Arizona. The Chiefs are appearing in this contest for the third time in four years, and will hope to emulate their performance from 2019 when they claimed a 31-20 victory over the San Francisco 49ers to lift the Vince Lombardi Trophy. The Eagles claimed their sole Super Bowl victory one year prior to that with a 41-33 win over the New England Patriots, when back-up quarterback Nick Foles famously caught a one-yard touchdown pass on a trick play that later became known as the Philly Special, and entered NFL folklore. Laura Woods presents, with analysis from Osi Umenyiora and Jason Bell

Romantic comedy drama, with Ashton Kutcher, Jessica Alba, Jamie Foxx, Jennifer Garner and Julia Roberts

programme.title: Love Island
programme.desc: More action from week five of the contest which sees single people living like celebrities in the villa, all under the watchful gaze of viewers. Maya Jama presents

programme.title: Kavos Weekender
programme.desc: The arrival of new guests brings an air of excitement amongst the reps - especially for Joel - much to Lucy's dismay

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Brian enters a dog competition in which the prize is to breed with a female, while Peter and Lois try to persuade Chris that Arthur Valentine does not exist

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Stewie meets a kindred spirit who shares his love of advanced weaponry, and Lois buys twin beds when she grows tired of being crushed by Peter, who subsequently struggles to fall asleep without a night-time cuddle. With guest star Cate Blanchett

programme.title: American Dad!
programme.desc: Francine is swept off her feet by a romantic cyborg version of her husband who has come back from the future, and the encounter forces her to question her relationship with the real Stan. Meanwhile, Roger directs Steve and his friends in a remake of cult classic adventure movie The Goonies

programme.title: American Dad!
programme.desc: Stan gets a new position as his boss's adviser and is delighted to accommodate his every request. However, the job begins to threaten his personal life and Francine is roped in to help complete an outrageous task, ruining her plans to spend Valentine's Day with her husband

programme.title: Superstore
programme.desc: Amy and Jonah steel themselves for a barrage of jokes and snide comments about their sex video as they return from a four-month suspension just in time for the back-to-school sale madness. However, they receive different treatment from their co-workers. Elsewhere, Jeff attempts to woo back Mateo. Comedy, starring America Ferrera

programme.title: Superstore
programme.desc: Jonah encourages Amy to have a small baby shower in order to stock up on much-needed baby supplies, but things quickly get out of hand. Meanwhile, Mateo art directs the photo shoot for Dina's Christmas card

programme.title: Hey Tracey!
programme.desc: Comedy quiz hosted by Joel Dommett, with Joey Essex, Amber Davies, Arron Crascall, Frankie Bridge, AJ Odudu and Russell Kane making cold calls to businesses to try to get the answers to quiz questions and win money for members of the public

programme.desc: Buying goods from the comfort of home

programme.title: On the Buses

programme.title: Doc Martin
programme.desc: Pauline is all set to achieve her ambition when she is given the chance to join the Portwenn lifeboat crew. However, her joy is short-lived when she discovers the chauvinistic tendencies of her shipmates. Martin is accused of murder by the husband of a woman who died in his care. The irate man resorts to sabotaging Aunt Joan's crops in retaliation but an unexpected twist reveals the true motivation for his ire

programme.title: Doc Martin
programme.desc: The doctor is surprised when his parents visit out of the blue, but they bring unwelcome tidings for all, especially Aunt Joan, who may be driven from her home. School secretary Maureen receives better news when what she thought was her thyroid problem turns out to be a pregnancy. Louisa calls Martin after Danny collapses - but the ambulance is delayed and emergency surgery must be performed to save his life

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: The Belgian detective begins to suspect something is amiss when he visits one of his favoured haunts in London for dinner and discovers a fellow regular has dramatically changed his diet. Down in Brighton, elderly Anthony Gascoigne lies dying while his estranged twin brother Henry falls to his death - but nobody is sure whether the man was deliberately pushed. Bizarrely, the key to the riddle seems to lie in a blackberry pie. David Suchet stars in the title role, with Philip Jackson, Hugh Fraser and Pauline Moran

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: When the sleuth's dentist is found dead just minutes after he leaves his surgery, Chief Inspector Japp believes it to be suicide - but Poirot has reason to think otherwise and embarks on his own investigation. Drama, starring David Suchet

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: When a spate of petty thefts culminates in a series of murders at a student hostel, Miss Lemon persuades the Belgian sleuth to investigate. As ever, he receives support from Chief Inspector Japp. Mystery, starring David Suchet, with Philip Jackson, Pauline Moran, Damian Lewis and Paris Jefferson

programme.title: Rosemary & Thyme
programme.desc: The green-fingered sleuths are hired to work behind the scenes of a garden makeover TV show, but Rosemary has an accident while standing in for the programme's star and ends up in hospital. Realising someone is trying to sabotage the series, Laura teams up with no-nonsense presenter Quinnie Dorell (Belinda Lang) to catch the culprit. Drama, starring Felicity Kendal and Pam Ferris

programme.title: Rosemary & Thyme
programme.desc: Laura and Rosemary are hired to create a restaurant garden on Italy's Ligurian coast, but it is not long before their working holiday is disrupted by a murder. Determined to solve the crime before returning home, they find themselves with no shortage of suspects - and matters are complicated further by a second death. Guest starring Suzanne Bertish (Rome) and Tristan Gemmill (Casualty), with Felicity Kendal and Pam Ferris

programme.title: Long Lost Family
programme.desc: Singer-songwriter KT Tunstall always knew she was adopted and in 1998 was reunited with her birth mother, who told her that her father never wanted to give her up - a message that has inspired her to find out what happened to him. Brother and sister Simon Munro and Carole Killick grew up apart after their mother left when they were young in the 1960s, but the siblings were reunited more than 20 years ago and are now searching for their mother. Davina McCall and Nicky Campbell present

programme.title: Joanna Lumley's Silk Road Adventure
programme.desc: As her Silk Road journey continues, Joanna travels to the Islamic Republic of Iran, where she meets many people eager to share the culture and innovations of the Persian civilisation, which spread far beyond modern day Iran. From ancient water gardens created to be paradise on Earth, through desert cities, endless bazaars and majestic mosques, Joanna discovers a country brimming with hospitality and warmth. Her Iranian adventure finishes in the Persian Empire's ancient ceremonial capital, Persepolis

programme.title: Grantchester
programme.desc: Detective drama set in a 1950s Cambridgeshire village, where local vicar Sidney Chambers (James Norton) develops a sideline in sleuthing - with the initially reluctant help of grumpy DI Geordie Keating (Robson Green). The cleric's first case finds him presiding over the funeral of a solicitor, who is believed to have taken his own life. However, the dead man's mistress has a different theory - and feeling unable to go to the police, she asks Sidney to examine it for her. He uncovers evidence that the suicide was staged, but while he's busy delving into the personal life of the victim, will the vicar miss his own big chance with Amanda Kendall (Morven Christie), the woman he secretly loves? With Tessa Peake-Jones, Kacey Ainsworth and Rachel Shelley

programme.title: Grantchester
programme.desc: Poor Sidney. His sister Jen bullies him into attending Amanda's engagement dinner - seeing the love of his life celebrate her betrothal to another man is the last thing the village vicar wants. He sinks a few too many drinks in a bid to make the evening more palatable, but it doesn't work - in fact, nobody at the event seems happy. Tensions rise between Amanda and Jen's old school friends, and then matters erupt when Jen's boyfriend Johnny (Ukweli Roach, Starlings) is accused of stealing Amanda's engagement ring. Later, the unfortunate chap is accused of murdering one of his fellow guests, and evidence at the scene of the crime seems to back up the theory. But Sidney isn't convinced - can he unmask the real killer?

programme.title: Upstairs, Downstairs
programme.desc: Elizabeth longs for a baby, but Lawrence is incapable of consummating their marriage and asks Sir Edwin Partridge to step in and help save it. Nicola Pagett and Gordon Jackson star

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: A woman seeks justice when her husband suffers a fatal heart attack after confronting a burglar. Meanwhile, Greengrass prepares for the gooseberry competition at the village fair

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: When Greengrass finds an unexploded bomb the Army is called in to deal with it, but one woman refuses to leave her home. Police drama, starring Nick Berry and Bill Maynard

programme.title: Ridley
programme.desc: Alex and Carol are called out to look into the death of a man who seemingly fell from his balcony. During the investigation, the retired detective makes a shocking discovery that links the current case with the arson attack that killed his family

programme.title: Grantchester
programme.desc: A heartbroken Sidney agrees to help parishioner Isabel prepare for her wedding to Arthur, the new man in town, but the bride's stubborn mother, Daisy, proves to be a big impediment to the occasion as she believes the groom is out to kill her. When Daisy is then found dead, Mrs Maguire calls in Geordie to investigate, and Sidney finds himself dragged into the case - despite vowing to leave police business behind. While the victim seems to have died of natural causes, Arthur and Isabel are pushing for a fast cremation, suggesting the couple have something to hide. Jean Marsh and Isla Blair guest star

programme.title: Grantchester
programme.desc: Sidney is woken in the early hours by a fire in the village and, putting his life on the line, races to rescue Marion Taylor from the burning house, much to the relief of her husband Dominic. But there are questions surrounding the blaze - was it really an accident, and why was Marion so reluctant to leave? Normally Sidney would turn to Geordie to help solve a mystery like this, but he finds the detective is far from his usual self. When Dominic is then found stabbed to death, it's Geordie's junior, Atkins, who is sent to head up the case - and he's not exactly a fan of interfering vicars

programme.desc: Toyah struggles to make up her mind about Goran, while Roy and Fred clash over their plans for the re-enactment

programme.title: Maigret
programme.desc: The sleuth is visited by Ernestine, the wife of a burglar known as 'Sad Freddie'. While breaking into a house he discovered a body and is so alarmed he has fled the country. The trail leads Maigret to a dentist who lives with his domineering elderly mother. Drama, starring Michael Gambon

programme.title: Maigret
programme.desc: The sleuth receives an unexpected visit from a provincial schoolteacher who is convinced that he will be accused of murdering his village's spiteful postmistress. Detective drama, starring Michael Gambon

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Nick investigates a spate of sinister burglaries, while Greengrass and Blaketon become trapped underground while searching for buried treasure. Nick Berry stars

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Nick goes undercover as a DJ to track down drugs smugglers. Rural police drama, starring Nick Berry and Bill Maynard

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Barnaby visits his Aunt Alice, who is recovering from an operation at a nursing home, and finds himself in the middle of a mystery. A resident has been found dead and the official verdict is a heart attack, but as rumours of fraud and deception abound, Alice's friend believes someone may have conspired to commit murder

programme.title: Grantchester
programme.desc: Sidney takes Geordie to Johnny Johnson's London jazz club, hoping to leave their worries in Grantchester for the night, but the backstage murder of Johnny's sister Claudette puts paid to that. When Archie, the victim's father and owner of the club, calls in a police officer pal to crack the case, Geordie immediately detects the copper is corrupt, while Sidney makes an important discovery about Claudette that she had kept hidden from all but those closest to her. As every lead seems to come back to Archie's violent past, recriminations within the family begin to play out

programme.title: Grantchester
programme.desc: With Amanda and Guy's wedding fast approaching, and his betrayal of Hildegard still fresh in his mind, Sidney is thrown deep into crisis, and the murder of a local cop doesn't help matters as he allows himself to become drawn into another case with Geordie. However, tragedy strikes as the duo close in on the killer, and with Geordie's life hanging in the balance, the clergyman finds himself cut out of the investigation as the police close ranks. But that doesn't stop him enlisting the help of Mrs Maguire and Leonard in a daring mission to gather information on the man who shot his partner

programme.desc: Alex and Carol are called out to look into the death of a man who seemingly fell from his balcony. During the investigation, the retired detective makes a shocking discovery that links the current case with the arson attack that killed his family

programme.title: Grantchester
programme.desc: A heartbroken Sidney agrees to help parishioner Isabel prepare for her wedding to Arthur, the new man in town, but the bride's stubborn mother, Daisy, proves to be a big impediment to the occasion as she believes the groom is out to kill her. When Daisy is then found dead, Mrs Maguire calls in Geordie to investigate, and Sidney finds himself dragged into the case - despite vowing to leave police business behind. While the victim seems to have died of natural causes, Arthur and Isabel are pushing for a fast cremation, suggesting the couple have something to hide. Jean Marsh and Isla Blair guest star

programme.title: Grantchester
programme.desc: Sidney is woken in the early hours by a fire in the village and, putting his life on the line, races to rescue Marion Taylor from the burning house, much to the relief of her husband Dominic. But there are questions surrounding the blaze - was it really an accident, and why was Marion so reluctant to leave? Normally Sidney would turn to Geordie to help solve a mystery like this, but he finds the detective is far from his usual self. When Dominic is then found stabbed to death, it's Geordie's junior, Atkins, who is sent to head up the case - and he's not exactly a fan of interfering vicars

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: Jacqui is wrongly suspected of stealing from the hospital, leaving her wondering whether she can manage by herself after all, while Stephen heads off for university _ despite being somewhat preoccupied with other matters. Rural drama, starring Pam Ferris and Sarah Lancashire

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: The nerves set in as Sandra wakes for the first day of her new job, which sees her helping a man understand his poorly father's deteriorating condition. programme.title: Grantchester
programme.desc: With Amanda and Guy's wedding fast approaching, and his betrayal of Hildegard still fresh in his mind, Sidney is thrown deep into crisis, and the murder of a local cop doesn't help matters as he allows himself to become drawn into another case with Geordie. programme.desc: A report from Southeast Asia, of something in the water that's sliced cleanly through a young man's testicles, is enough to lure 'fishing detective' Jeremy Wade to the shores of the Mekong - a river long renowned for its monstrous fish. But what kind of creature could have inflicted such a distinctive, surgical wound? In his quest to expose the unseen mutilator, Jeremy uncovers multiple victims who've been mauled, half-blinded, and even fatally wounded by the same mysterious assailant - a baby-faced killer that appears to be proliferating

programme.title: River Monsters
programme.desc: Jeremy Wade returns to Africa's Okavango Delta to reinvestigate the tigerfish - a pack-hunting carnivore previously blamed for mauling the victims of a capsized boat. In a bid to flush out the true nature of these sight-hunting predators, Jeremy puts on his dive gear and offers himself as live bait

programme.desc: Animated series. The Ninjas take stock of the situation in the subway car as the Council of the Crystal King attacks the Ninja Cave - Wu, Pixal, Skylor and Nya hold them off with the help of Pixal's MiniPix, but Harumi's Crystal Spiders bomb the cave. The villains escape with the Weapons of Spinjitzu and the surviving MiniPix rescues everyone but Nya, who escapes in her Samurai X Mech and blasts off to save the Ninjas.

programme.title: LEGO Ninjago
programme.desc: Animated series. Nya, who is in her mech, frees the Ninjas from the collapsed subway tunnel and flies them to their new base at the old Samurai X Cave - back at the Crystal Temple, Harumi guides the Council of the Crystal King through a ritual to transform the Weapons of Spinjitzu into the Weapons of Destruction... and the Crystal King also takes physical form.

programme.title: LEGO Ninjago
programme.desc: Animated series. The Crystal King gives his Council new powers and floats the temple into the sky - he gives Lloyd one last chance to join his side, but Lloyd refuses and attempts to escape. Lloyd evades the Council of the Crystal King and pulls Harumi out of the temple with him - they fall to the jungle below, but Lloyd's tracking signal alerts the Ninjas to his location.

programme.title: LEGO Ninjago
programme.desc: Animated series. The Ninjas steal back Destiny's Bounty and their vehicles from the police impound lot with a surprise assist from Master Wu - they head for Primeval's Eye, where Lloyd navigates the dense jungle and evades the Council of the Crystal King with Harumi as his prisoner. Lloyd releases Harumi and joins the Ninjas, but they temporarily retreat at the sight of the Crystal King's power.

programme.title: LEGO Ninjago
programme.desc: Animated series. The Ninjas clash with the Crystal King's army as his temple floats towards Ninjago City, but the vengestone warriors negate the Ninjas' elemental powers and the crystals drain their vehicles. Master Wu and Lloyd track down cryptic warnings of this event - with the help of the paperkids, they follow the clues back to Garmadon, who is living in Ninjago City with NGTV News cameraman Vinny.

programme.title: LEGO Ninjago
programme.desc: Animated series. Garmadon shares his journey of personal growth with Master Wu and Lloyd - Vinny has taught Garmadon compassion through caring for a plant named Christofern. Garmadon breaks his vow of non-violence when Crystal Warriors attack the apartment - he defeats the enemies by taking on a powerful Oni Form that Master Wu believes could be the key to defeating the Crystal King.

programme.title: LEGO Ninjago
programme.desc: Animated series. The Ninjas retreat to the Samurai X Cave to strategise - Garmadon is there and teaching Lloyd to master his Oni Form. Lloyd struggles because he does not want to embrace his darker side, but Master Wu believes that there must be an equal and opposite Dragon Form and reaches out to Misako to research. When Pixal upgrades the Ninjas' vehicles after studying a sample of crystal, they return to battle.

programme.title: LEGO Ninjago
programme.desc: Animated series. The Ninjas race through Ninjago City in their new golden vehicles and take out Crystal Warriors with the power boost that Pixal installed - their hope is short-lived, however, and the Destiny's Bounty is attacked by Dragonides. As the Crystal Beasts take the Ninjas' new vehicles out of commission, Master Wu confronts the Crystal King, but both he and the Bounty are blasted out of the sky.

programme.title: LEGO Ninjago
programme.desc: Animated series. Master Wu parachutes from the Crystal Temple and is found by paperkids Nelson and Antonia - meanwhile, Jay rescues Nya from the wreckage of the Destiny's Bounty, and Nya in turn saves Jay from Crystal Warriors by reawakening her elemental powers. The pair head to the harbour with a plan to call for reinforcements as Nelson and Antonia bring Master Wu back to the newspaper warehouse, where he broadcasts a message of hope.

programme.title: LEGO Ninjago
programme.desc: Animated series. Lloyd and Garmadon escape from Hounddog McBrag into the sewers, where Lloyd saves McBrag from the crystal-infected Serpentine - meanwhile, Misako returns to the warehouse with scrolls confirming that Dragon Form exists, but the text is incomplete. Elsewhere, Pixal rescues Zane, but his memory is damaged along with his body, and his Ice Emperor persona soon resurfaces as Ronin and other escaped fugitives escort Pixal to Borg Tower.

programme.title: LEGO Ninjago
programme.desc: Animated series. The Ninjas regroup at the warehouse with their new fugitive allies, but when they fail to master Dragon Form, Nelson discovers a clue in the scroll that the Ninjas must perform a selfless act as their allies unite. Borg warns that the Crystal Army is headed to the warehouse for a final assault, so the Ninjas prepare their defences as Lloyd and Garmadon head to the temple to confront the Crystal King.

programme.title: LEGO Ninjago
programme.desc: Animated series. Kai and Skylor bond over cooking for refugees, Master Wu and Misako struggle to decipher the Dragon Form scroll, and Cole uses the paperkid dispatch to contact the rest of the Ninjas and coordinate outreach to their allies. Meanwhile, Cyrus Borg repairs Zane and Pixal brings him back online with an emotional outreach - she summons her new mech from the Samurai X Cave, and Borg outfits Ronin's fugitives with mechs.

programme.title: LEGO Ninjago
programme.desc: Animated series. Jay and Nya contact Benthomaar at the harbour while Racer 7 and Vinny escort Cole through Ninjago City to broadcast a distress call to Princess Vania - meanwhile, Lloyd and Garmadon search the sewers for the missing Serpentine, and Lloyd believes that his father might be a changed man after Garmadon spares the life of a crystal-infected Serpentine. Later, Master Wu summons the Ninjas back to the warehouse.

programme.title: LEGO Ninjago
programme.desc: Animated series. The Ninjas regroup at the warehouse with their new fugitive allies, but when they fail to master Dragon Form, Nelson discovers a clue in the scroll that the Ninjas must perform a selfless act as their allies unite. Borg warns that the Crystal Army is headed to the warehouse for a final assault, so the Ninjas prepare their defences as Lloyd and Garmadon head to the temple to confront the Crystal King.

programme.title: LEGO Ninjago
programme.desc: Animated series. As Lloyd and Garmadon battle the Crystal King in his new centaur-form, the Ninjas' allies arrive and they achieve Dragon Form, which equips them with golden armour and wings of elemental energy - at the same time, the Crystal King turns Harumi against him when he reveals that he possessed the snake who would become the Great Devourer. The Ninjas defeat the Council and restore the Weapons of Spinjitzu, but their victory is short-lived.

programme.title: LEGO Ninjago
programme.desc: Animated series. The Ninjas show their true potential and perform a selfless act to save Ninjago from the Crystal King.

programme.title: Gino's Italian Escape
programme.desc: Chef Gino D'Acampo tours his homeland by train, taking in some of some of the most scenic train journeys in Europe. He begins in the French Alpine town of Breil-sur-Roya, so he can travel into Italy in style. Once in his own country, he meets a doctor who does his rounds on horseback, and visits hazelnut groves where he prepares a chocolate cheesecake. In Turin, he fulfils a lifelong dream of racing on top of the world-famous Lingotto rooftop track and makes his final dish - fettuccine pasta with mascarpone and pork mince

programme.title: Gino's Italian Escape
programme.desc: For the next leg of his journey, Gino D'Acampo boards an old steam train run by ex-railroad men and volunteers which takes him through the beautiful Tuscan countryside. His first stop is the town of Asciano, where locals try to compete with Siena's famous Palio horse race - only here they ride donkeys. Then it's on to the Chianti region where he visits a vineyard where they don't only make wine, but they also bathe in it too, an ancient tradition dating back to Roman times. After a luxurious wine bath, Gino cooks up a dish fit for any Emperor - farfalle pasta with funghi and spinach

programme.title: The Simpsons

Animated comedy, with the voices of Jack Black, Dustin Hoffman, Angelina Jolie, Ian McShane and Jackie Chan

programme.title: The Andrew Neil Show

programme.title: World's Most Secret Hotels
programme.desc: In New York, the TWA Hotel is close by the John F Kennedy International Airport. Its interiors hark back to the spirit of the 1960s jet age, but with a 21st-century twist. Here, visitors can check in at the old baggage check and enjoy dining in what used to be an airport lounge. In Finnish Lapland, visitors to the snow-capped forest of the Urho Kekkonen National Park can spend a night sleeping under the stars at the Kakslauttanen Arctic Resort. This getaway boasts 65 state-of-the-art, arctic-resistant glass igloos. There are also visits to unique and unusual hotels in Canada and Scotland

programme.title: The Great Pottery Throw Down

Siobhán McSweeney hosts, with regular judges Keith Brymer Jones and Rich Miller setting the challenges

programme.title: Guy Martin's Great British Power Trip
programme.desc: As an energy crisis and cost of living crisis collide, the Lincolnshire lorry mechanic and motorcycle racer investigates the past, present and future of British power stations to work out how the country makes its most valuable commodity of all - electricity. This first episode begins with Guy testing every piece of equipment in his workshop to find out which items use the most electricity. Horrified by what he's now having to pay for power, he tries to work out the reasons behind his big bills, and visits his local power station at Drax - which also happens to be the country's biggest

programme.title: Dispatches
programme.desc: The extraordinary story of Russia's covert attempts to corrupt British politics, influence government policy and undermine our democracy in the years before the invasion of Ukraine. Over the past 12 years, donors with links to Russia have poured millions into the coffers of the ruling Conservative Party. Dispatches reveals how senior politicians ignored the warnings about President Putin to the detriment of our national security, how political activists were encouraged to visit a Moscow strip club, and hears allegations concerning a Russian 'diplomat' seeking information from a government minister over a pint in a pub

programme.title: The Girl on the Train (2016)
programme.desc: Having lost her job and her husband, alcoholic Rachel Watson spends time aimlessly travelling on a train. She gets drawn into a web of intrigue when she becomes fascinated by a woman's disappearance. Rachel thinks she has vital evidence in cracking the case, but gaps in her memory cloud her judgment, and before long her own life is endangered. Thriller based on Paula Hawkins' novel, starring Emily Blunt, Rebecca Ferguson, Haley Bennett, Justin Theroux and Luke Evans

programme.title: A Hidden Life (2019)

A salesman visits Poo HQ to find out if his psoriasis could be linked to his gut health, and a businesswoman with multiple allergies asks if they could be connected to her bowel issues. Danny Altman shares his research into the relationship between gut health and Long Covid

Ten months later her body was found on nearby wasteland and forensic analysis showed the remains had been dissolved in acid. Emilia Fox, Professor David Wilson and Dr Graham Hill investigate Tina's murder and uncover some sinister events in the community that could be connected to her murder

programme.title: Kangaroo Beach

programme.title: Peppa Pig

programme.title: Peppa Pig

programme.title: Paw Patrol

programme.title: Pip and Posy
programme.desc: Posy persuades Pip to swap toys for keeps, but soon regrets her decision

programme.title: The Adventures of Paddington

programme.title: Milo

programme.title: Paw Patrol

programme.title: Milkshake! Bop Box Boogie

programme.title: Pip and Posy

programme.title: Milkshake! Story Den
