programme.title: Sunny Bunnies
programme.desc: The adventures of five colourful balls of light Turbo, Hopper, Boo, Iris and Shiny

programme.title: Jeremy Vine
programme.desc: The broadcaster and guests discuss the issues of the day, with co-host Storm Huntley joining him for phone-ins and reading out viewers' correspondence

programme.title: Build a New Life in the Country
programme.desc: Gez and Laura want to leave London for the coast. After a three-year wait for planning consent, they finally begin work on their dream home - a beach house in Worthing, West Sussex. Refusing to compromise when it comes to cost and materials, they must pull out all the stops to complete the project by the summer

programme.title: 5 News at Lunchtime
programme.desc: Round-up of the day's headlines from around the world

programme.title: Home and Away
programme.desc: Ziggy is getting cabin fever over her forced bed rest. At her wit's end, she steals Mac's car to escape the house. Felicity twigs the tension between her brother and best friend

programme.title: An Organised Killer (2021)
programme.desc: Grace hires a live-in personal assistant, Lilith, but soon things start to unravel and Grace's life begins to fall apart. Thriller, starring Allison McAtee

programme.title: Bargain-Loving Brits in the Sun
programme.desc: Meeting up with Val, an 82-year-old originally from Wales, who is now a bargain-loving Brit living in Mijas on the Costa del Sol. Today, she's going to be making her way down a local valley on a zip wire, with her best friend Alan and a couple of other Brits with a combined age of 313 years. Cameras also follow restaurant owner Paula, her dog Piglet, flatmate Lisa and all the staff of the Mad Munk in Benidorm

programme.title: 5 News at 5
programme.desc: Round-up of the day's headlines from around the world

programme.title: Our Yorkshire Farm
programme.desc: The family has recently discovered that their home is more than 700 years old, which inspires Edith and Violet to search the barn for evidence of previous occupants. Clemmy helps Amanda to treat a ewe suffering from a nasty ailment, while the discovery of a collection of toy steam trains sparks a restoration project for Clive and the boys

programme.title: 5 News Update
programme.desc: The latest reports

programme.title: GPs: Behind Closed Doors
programme.desc: Dr Amir Khan meets James who is very frank about his heart failure diagnosis and two prior heart attacks. He also meets Andrea, who is dealing with the aftermath of a hysterectomy, and Dr Eleanor Beecraft reassures Anne, who is suffering with back pain and is worried it may have something to do with her kidneys

programme.title: 5 News Update
programme.desc: The latest reports

programme.title: Dogs Behaving (Very) Badly
programme.desc: Nature-loving couple Fran and Ben would love nothing more than to enjoy the beautiful countryside that surrounds their home city of Swansea, but their hyper reactive Doberman Kobi is making that neigh on impossible. Elsewhere, Graeme meets the owner of a Jack Russel that refuses to be loved and has no interest in human contact

programme.title: 5 News Update
programme.desc: The latest reports

programme.title: Ben Fogle: New Lives in the Wild
programme.desc: Ben journeys into the heart of Zambia to live with a British family who have built a safari lodge on the edge of a national park. Ben uncovers what prompted this intrepid couple to start a new business and a family in the unforgiving bush, and learns how they have had to overcome fire and flooding to keep their African dream alive

programme.title: The Railway Killers
programme.desc: Documentary about a series of murders of women at railway stations in London in the early 1980s, told through dramatic reconstruction and testimony from police officers and victims' friends. The programme charts the pivotal moments during the police's painstaking investigation, culminating in the eventual conviction of John Duffy and his accomplice David Mulcahy

programme.title: Crimes That Shook Britain
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the unsolved murder of Crimewatch presenter and newsreader Jill Dando, who was shot dead outside her house in Fulham, west London, in April 1999. Intense media coverage followed and several lines of enquiry were pursued, including a theory that she had been killed by a jealous ex-boyfriend and the idea that somebody had hired a hitman in revenge for a conviction linked to Crimewatch. Following a trial at the Old Bailey, 40-year-old Barry George was found guilty of Dando's murder, but a third appeal quashed his original conviction and resulted in his acquittal in 2009

programme.title: The LeoVegas Live Casino Show
programme.desc: Interactive gambling

programme.title: Entertainment News on 5
programme.desc: Showbiz news and gossip

programme.title: The Yorkshire Steam Railway: All Aboard
programme.desc: Under pressure to bring in extra revenue now that the somewhat challenging season is nearing its end, the North York Moors Railway team decides to put on a special 'curry train' night together with a massive bash for Halloween. Visitors and staff alike put in the effort to make it a night to remember, though proceedings are threatened when the lights in the carriages suddenly stop working. The Bishop of Wakefield comes to bless Eric Treacy, an engine that has been through a £500,000 overhaul taking over two years

programme.title: Paddington Station 24/7
programme.desc: A track circuit failure has been detected at Platform 5 and instructions from the signalling centre are to close it, putting the pressure on the Track Response team to fix the problem. British Transport Police are out in force as crowds of football fans pass through Paddington, while in the control room, Graeme is shocked to witness a young man walking dangerously close to the edge of a platform

programme.title: Great Artists
programme.desc: Tim Marlow examines the life and legacy of German painter Albrecht Durer, who set a new benchmark in self-portraiture and raised the artistic reputation of northern Europe to a level rivaling that of Renaissance Italy. Like his contemporary Leonardo da Vinci, Durer perceived the world with a scientist's eye, and his detailed studies of plants and animals remain unrivalled to this day

programme.title: House Doctor
programme.desc: Near Bristol, Ann Maurice and Alistair Appleton help a Portishead couple spruce up their bungalow to attract a quick sale. At £196,950, the price is right, but a few touches are needed to give the property 'kerb appeal'

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: The piglet and her family return from their holiday, while Suzy has missed her friend and is eager to see her again

programme.title: Paw Patrol
programme.desc: Farmer Al's sheep run away, and Mayor Humdinger's kittens go missing

programme.title: Pip and Posy
programme.desc: The pair meet their friends in the park for a game of football, but Posy gets upset when her football shaped lunch box is accidentally kicked into a tree

programme.title: Rugrats Go Wild (2003)
programme.desc: A leaky boat leaves the precocious youngsters stranded on a jungle island, but their luck changes when explorers the Wild Thornberrys come to their rescue. However, Thornberry dad Nigel loses his memory, so it falls to his daughter Eliza to save the day. Children's animated adventure, with the voices of Nancy Cartwright, Bruce Willis, Lacey Chabert, Elizabeth Daily and Tim Curry

programme.title: Rango (2011)
programme.desc: A pet chameleon with an active imagination ends up lost in the desert. He makes his way to a lawless town of animals, where he is mistaken for a deadly gunslinger and made sheriff. He organises the townsfolk into a posse when bandits led by an evil rattlesnake steal their supply of water. Oscar-winning animated comedy, with the voices of Johnny Depp, Isla Fisher and Bill Nighy

programme.title: The Chronicles of Narnia: The Voyage of the Dawn Treader (2010)
programme.desc: Lucy and Edmund Pevensie return to the magical world accompanied by their selfish cousin. They join their old friend King Caspian as he sets sail across the sea in search of seven of his father's allies who had been banished years before, but along the way they discover an evil force is growing in strength. Fantasy adventure, with Georgie Henley, Skandar Keynes, Will Poulter and Ben Barnes

programme.title: Black Knight (2001)
programme.desc: An employee at a run-down medieval theme park suffers a nasty fall and knocks himself out - only to wake up in 14th-century England, where he gets up to all manner of mischief with the knights in shining armour and damsels in distress. Comedy adventure, starring Martin Lawrence, Tom Wilkinson and Marsha Thomason

programme.title: Bill & Ted's Bogus Journey (1991)
programme.desc: The would-be heavy metal superstars face the Grim Reaper as they try to reclaim their souls from Hell, return to the land of the living and stop their robot doppelgangers from changing history. Along the way, they must also master their instruments, so they can triumph at the Battle of the Bands. Comedy sequel, starring Keanu Reeves, Alex Winter, William Sadler, Joss Ackland and George Carlin

programme.title: Gangs of New York (2002)
programme.desc: An Irishman in 19th-century New York is taken under the wing of the ruthless gang leader who killed his father 15 years before, and rises up the ranks of power - all the while plotting his revenge. Meanwhile, the tension caused by the enforced drafting of the population into the army to fight in the Civil War explodes into bloodshed and riots. Martin Scorsese's epic historical drama, starring Leonardo DiCaprio, Daniel Day-Lewis, Cameron Diaz and Liam Neeson

programme.title: Mid90s (2018)
programme.desc: During the 1990s in Los Angeles, 13-year-old Stevie spends his summer navigating between a troubled home life and a crew of new friends he meets at a skate shop. Writer/director Jonah Hill's comedy drama, starring Sunny Suljic, Katherine Waterston and Lucas Hedges

programme.title: Submarine (2010)
programme.desc: A 15-year-old boy determined to lose his virginity before he turns 16 becomes infatuated with a feisty classmate. He also has a more pressing mission to undertake as he tries to save his parents' failing marriage, despite his father's apathy and the return of his mother's smooth-talking ex. Comedy drama, with Craig Roberts, Sally Hawkins, Paddy Considine and Noah Taylor

programme.title: Legend of the Lost (1957)
programme.desc: A grizzled adventurer living in Timbuktu is hired to escort a mysterious explorer across the Sahara desert in search of a fabled lost city. A local woman joins the men on their quest, but when the trio reach their destination the explorer reveals his plan to betray his companions and leave them high and dry. Adventure, starring John Wayne, Sophia Loren and Rossano Brazzi

programme.title: Captain Scarlett (1953)
programme.desc: A brave nobleman forms a band of outlaws to free 19th-century French villagers from the tyranny of an evil duke, reclaim his birthright and save a lovely princess from a fate worse than death at the hands of a lecherous count. Swashbuckling adventure, starring Richard Greene, Leonora Amar, Nedrick Young and Manolo Fabregas

programme.title: The Blue Dahlia (1946)
programme.desc: A war-weary pilot returns home from service in Europe, but his welcome is far from warm. Not only must he deal with the news of his wife's infidelities, but he also finds himself accused of her murder. However, the wife of his dead spouse's lover is on hand to help him prove his innocence. Thriller, written by Raymond Chandler and starring Alan Ladd, Veronica Lake, William Bendix and Doris Dowling

programme.title: The Bedford Incident (1965)
programme.desc: The ruthless captain of a US destroyer develops an obsession with tracking down a Russian submarine. As he drives his men harder, he fails to anticipate the consequences of his actions - leading to a fatal mistake. Cold War thriller, starring Richard Widmark, Sidney Poitier, Martin Balsam, Wally Cox, Eric Portman and Donald Sutherland

programme.title: The Italian Job (1969)
programme.desc: A crook assembles a motley gang to steal £4million in gold bullion from an Italian armoured car, which brings Turin to a standstill and enables the robbers to make a quick getaway in a fleet of Minis - but they end up falling foul of the Mafia along the way. Crime comedy, starring Michael Caine, Noel Coward, Benny Hill, Tony Beckley and John Le Mesurier

programme.title: Olympus Has Fallen (2013)
programme.desc: A secret service operative is reassigned from Presidential Protection after a tragic accident. As he prepares to leave his assignment, terrorists take control of the White House and hold the president hostage. The agent is trapped in the building, and uses his inside knowledge to rescue the head of state. Action thriller, starring Gerard Butler, Aaron Eckhart and Morgan Freeman

programme.title: Jack Ryan: Shadow Recruit (2014)
programme.desc: A former soldier injured in the line of duty takes up a new career as a financial analyst for the CIA. However, his deskbound position changes to a dangerous undercover assignment when he discovers a plot to destroy the US economy. Spy thriller inspired by Tom Clancy's novels, starring Chris Pine, Keira Knightley, Kevin Costner and Kenneth Branagh, who also directed

programme.title: Racer and the Jailbird (2017)
programme.desc: Gigi, a high-flying gangster in Brussels, falls for Bibi, a young racing driver with upper-class roots. Thriller, starring Matthias Schoenaerts, Adele Exarchopoulos and Eric De Staercke. In French and Flemish

programme.title: The Desperados (1969)
programme.desc: A sadistic Confederate preacher leads his family on a campaign of violence and destruction during the American Civil War, but one of his three sons rejects them to lead a peaceful life under an assumed identity. Years after the conflict, the outcast is confronted by his villainous relatives once more as they cause mayhem in his new home town. Western, starring Jack Palance, Vince Edwards, George Maharis, Sylvia Syms and Kate O'Mara

programme.title: High Noon (1952)
programme.desc: A town marshal is torn between love and duty on his wedding day as he prepares for the arrival of a vengeful adversary on the midday train. Meanwhile, the townsfolk the marshal has so loyally protected are certain he will be killed in the confrontation and abandon him one by one to face his enemy alone. Western, starring Gary Cooper, Grace Kelly, Lloyd Bridges and Lee Van Cleef

programme.title: The Red Pony (1949)
programme.desc: A boy seeks solace from his feuding family through his friendships with his beloved pony and a ranch hand, whom he idolises. When the animal dies his relationship with his father seems to be damaged irreparably. Drama based on a short story by John Steinbeck, starring Robert Mitchum, Myrna Loy and Peter Miles

programme.title: The Long Arm (1956)
programme.desc: A dedicated Scotland Yard police superintendent battles to overcome stress both at home and work, while putting his instincts and scientific knowledge to the task of catching a notorious safecracker. However, the case takes a shocking turn when the elusive criminal commits murder. Crime thriller, starring Jack Hawkins, Dorothy Alison, Geoffrey Keen and Newton Blick

programme.title: Sense and Sensibility (1995)
programme.desc: An impoverished family is taken in by a relative - and while sensible elder daughter Elinor's love for the sensitive Edward Ferrars meets with disapproval from his family, her more passionate younger sister Marianne engages in a disastrous romance with an infamous womaniser. Period drama based on Jane Austen's novel, directed by Ang Lee and starring Emma Thompson, Kate Winslet, Alan Rickman and Hugh Grant

programme.title: Four Weddings and a Funeral (1994)
programme.desc: A London man's misfortunes in love look set to change when he meets an American beauty. However, the prospect of a transatlantic relationship succeeding seems slim, so the pair go their separate ways - only for him to realise he is unable to get her out of his mind. Richard Curtis's comedy, with Hugh Grant, Andie MacDowell, John Hannah, Charlotte Coleman, Kristin Scott Thomas, Simon Callow and James Fleet

programme.title: The Shape of Water (2017)
programme.desc: Elisa Esposito is a mute singleton who lives above a cinema. Although friends with Giles, a neighbouring artist, she lives a lonely existence. While he has designs on the cafe worker nearby, Elisa cleans up at top-secret government lab, a bus ride away in Baltimore, Maryland. One day in 1962, she makes a life-changing discovery when Elisa finds an amphibious humanoid creature who is being held captive, and they embark on an extraordinary relationship. Guillermo del Toro's Oscar and Bafta-winning fantasy, starring Sally Hawkins, Michael Shannon, Octavia Spencer and Doug Jones

programme.title: The Duke of Burgundy (2014)
programme.desc: A butterfly expert develops a sexual relationship with her housekeeper based on sadomasochism. However, while the servant revels in her submissive role, her employer begins to grow weary of dominating her lover, placing a strain on their life together. Drama with an all-female cast, starring Sidse Babett Knudsen and Chiara D'Anna

programme.title: Hollyoaks Omnibus
programme.desc: Extended edition of the soap

programme.title: Rude(ish) Tube
programme.desc: Comedy clips showcasing amusing internet videos, including cats 'singing' the Star Wars theme tune and an escaped honey badger

programme.title: Ramsay's Hotel Hell
programme.desc: Part two of two. Gordon Ramsay continues to uncover problems at the Juniper Hill Inn in Windsor, Vermont. The chef tries to help the staff communicate with owners Robert and Ari, but after he catches one of them telling a shocking lie, will it be the final straw?

programme.title: Ramsay's Hotel Hell
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay checks in to the River Rock Inn in Milford, Pennsylvania, where owner Ken Pisciotta is struggling to attract guests and battling huge debts. He has all but given up and his constant negativity is rubbing off on the staff. Can Gordon get this establishment back on track before Ken loses everything?

programme.title: Ramsay's Hotel Hell
programme.desc: Supercar fanatic Eddie Kaen has spent millions on the design of the Keating in San Diego, California, but neglected to invest in things the guests really need. Gordon Ramsay's visit uncovers empty rooms, a failing restaurant and staff at the end of their tether - leading to a shocking crisis that nobody saw coming

programme.title: Ramsay's Hotel Hell
programme.desc: Chef Gordon Ramsay visits Meson de Mesilla, a Tuscan-style hotel in Las Cruces, New Mexico. Owner and former child-star Cali Szczawinski purchased the hotel so she could perform Cher songs every night to a captive audience, but Gordon investigates whether she may be falling flat when it comes to the needs of her guests because she's too busy trying to hit the high notes on stage

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: As Howard and his fellow astronauts sit in the space shuttle awaiting launch, he reflects on the tumultuous events of the previous few days, when he and Bernadette tried to get married. Meanwhile, his friends witness the blast-off on TV at home

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Despite being on the International Space Station, Howard gets caught in a strange argument between Bernadette and his mother via video link. Elsewhere, Raj feels lonely while his best friend is away and ends up interfering with Sheldon's and Leonard's dates. Comedy, starring Simon Helberg

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Penny tells the girls she is unsure about her relationship with Leonard and is considering breaking up with him, but when Sheldon finds out, he tries his best to change her mind. Meanwhile, on the International Space Station, Howard is being bullied by the other astronauts. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon hires an attractive female assistant, but when she becomes interested in Leonard, Penny decides to mark her territory by sleeping with him. Meanwhile, Howard starts to lose his mind when his return from space is delayed another week. Comedy, starring Jim Parsons

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Howard returns from his space mission, but the welcome from his friends and family does not meet his expectations. His night alone with Bernadette goes badly, his mother ignores him, and he realises Stuart has taken his place as Raj's best friend. On top of that, Sheldon, Amy, Leonard and Penny kick him out of their group games night. Comedy, starring Simon Helberg

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Stuart hosts a Halloween party at the comic-book store, and Howard talks incessantly about his work on board the International Space Station, annoying his wife and friends. Penny and Leonard have a steamy encounter at the lab. Guest starring real-life astronaut Buzz Aldrin

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Penny makes an important decision after Leonard tries to help her in the aftermath of a failed role on a TV show. Meanwhile, Raj and Stuart practise talking to strangers at a shopping centre, and Sheldon studies to become a comic genius. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon tries to relax after he is forced to take a holiday, and when Penny quits her job the duo end up spending time together. Meanwhile, Leonard struggles to be supportive of his girlfriend's career decision, Bernadette seeks Stuart's help in replacing one of Howard's comic books, and Howard and Raj provide Amy with some advice. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: When the guys are unable to get tickets for Comic-Con, Leonard, Howard and Raj decide to buy fake passes from a stranger - but they then worry about getting caught with them. Sheldon decides to hold his own comic-book convention and searches for a suitable star guest for the event. Meanwhile, the girls take tea at a hotel but discover that maturity is over-rated. Comedy, guest starring James Earl Jones and Carrie Fisher

programme.title: Lego Masters Australia
programme.desc: The seven remaining teams are challenged to build tiny dragons that are small enough to be carried on a drone, with the winner getting an advantage for the second build

programme.title: Evolution (2001)
programme.desc: Two science teachers investigate a mysterious meteor and discover it is oozing a strange fluid containing millions of minuscule but rapidly evolving organisms - which start to turn into terrifying alien monsters with a taste for human flesh. Sci-fi comedy, starring David Duchovny, Orlando Jones, Julianne Moore, Seann William Scott, Dan Aykroyd and Ted Levine

programme.title: Mission: Impossible - Fallout (2018)
programme.desc: Ethan Hunt and the IMF team join forces with CIA assassin August Walker to prevent a disaster caused by mysterious arms dealer John Lark and a group of terrorists known as the Apostles. However, Hunt and his colleagues are soon pushed to their limits thanks to a face from their past. Writer/director Christopher McQuarrie's sixth entry in the action thriller saga, starring Tom Cruise and Henry Cavill

programme.title: Gogglebox

programme.desc: Anna Richardson welcomes 45-year-old twice-divorced Nicola, who is hoping one of the six naked men behind the screens has what it takes to be husband number three. Second up is Mark from London, who has Crohn's disease and hopes to regain some body confidence on the show

programme.title: Summer House
programme.desc: Fireworks continue as the 4 July party winds down. Lindsay reconnects with Everett. Kyle and Amanda work together on their new start-up

programme.title: Summer House
programme.desc: Danielle forgives Jordan, but he continues to wreak havoc in the house, leading his housemates to question who he really is. Kyle makes a romantic gesture to woo Amanda

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Warren opens up to Norma about his love for Sienna. Later, Norma seeks help from Ethan and Sienna when she realises Grace has gone missing

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: A vulnerable Grace fears for her son's life and plans to leave the village. Meanwhile, Norma comes up with a new plan, and Tony and Diane have a heartfelt conversation

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The chef heads to Eagle Rock in California to try to change the fortunes of Capri, a grubby restaurant which often remains closed during lunchtime because of the twin owners' lazy attitude. A crisis ensues as soon as Gordon Ramsay instructs the duo to clean the place, revealing that only tough measures are likely to save the business

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: In this revisit episode, chef Gordon Ramsay goes back to Mojito, the Junction (formerly known as Flamangos) and Bazzini to check in with the owners he helped in the past and find out whether his advice has been put to good use. Will he be pleased with their progress?

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: Murray is honoured as one of the area's top businessmen, Beverly's attempt to help her husband find a hobby backfires, and Erica comes to the rescue when Barry's scheme to steal golf carts goes awry

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: A scary TV movie motivates Barry to beg his father to build an underground bunker for the family, but Murray isn't easily persuaded. Erica and Adam go over the top with lavish Mother's Day gifts for Beverly before bringing important requests to her. Comedy, starring Wendi McLendon-Covey and Jeff Garlin

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard's purchase of a dining-room table causes Sheldon to re-evaluate his life. Meanwhile, Howard is offered the chance to go back to the International Space Station, and Bernadette struggles to decide whether to encourage him. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Melissa Rauch

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: After arguing with Sheldon, Howard tries to make amends by taking him to Nasa's headquarters in Houston. Elsewhere, Penny has second thoughts about quitting her job as a waitress when her car dies, while Amy tries to find Raj a date. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Jay accidentally gatecrashes Mitch and Cameron's night out with their friends Pepper, Longines and Crispin, but surprisingly enjoys his time with the group. Meanwhile, Phil and Claire are concerned when Luke befriends neighbour Mr Kleezak, and despite Cameron's misgivings, Haley babysits Lily. Guest starring Nathan Lane (The Producers)

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Cameron is delighted to accept the role of interim music director at Luke and Manny's school, but his enthusiasm fails to rub off on the students. Meanwhile, Jay's brother Donnie (guest star Jonathan Banks) comes to town, but their sibling rivalry goes too far, and Phil persuades his family to appear in his new advert

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: Boyle brings Peralta into a case when a psychiatrist reports one of his patients missing, while Santiago believes she has accidentally received a package meant for Jeffords

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: Work has become so busy for Peralta and Santiago that they end up celebrating their first wedding anniversary while standing guard over a comatose drugs baron who has been rushed into hospital after being shot

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: When Sheldon kicks Amy out of the apartment so that he can have some 'alone time' to work, she and Leonard bond during a series of science experiments. Bert the geologist replaces Howard in his band Footprints on the Moon, and Sheldon finds Penny to be a surprising source of scientific inspiration. Laurie Metcalf and Brian Posehn guest star

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Raj finds himself in the middle of a domestic drama when he realises that the woman he's dating, Nell, has a husband, Oliver, who is very upset about their new relationship. Sheldon rents his old room back to have a quiet place to work and drives Leonard crazy by being a model tenant

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon is forced to teach a course at the university, and Howard surprises the gang when he decides to enrol on it. Meanwhile, Amy plays Penny and Bernadette off against each other while the tension brews over Penny's new job. Comedy, guest starring Regina King (Southland), with Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard and Penny attempt to prove Sheldon wrong when he claims that he and Amy have a superior relationship. Meanwhile, Howard is nervous when Nasa asks him to throw the first pitch at a baseball game honouring National Space Day. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Jay helps Manny with a school fundraiser involving lots of wrapping paper, and Claire petitions for a stop sign at a busy junction. Meanwhile, Mitchell is determined to prove a point to Cameron, but neither of them will back down. American comedy, guest starring David Cross (Arrested Development), with Ed O'Neill and Julie Bowen

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: All the men in the three dysfunctional households feel angry - including Mitch and Cam, who are involved in a traffic accident, and Jay, who is frustrated at work. American comedy, starring Ed O'Neill and Julie Bowen

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: Competitive juices are flowing as Jake and the squad compete in the second Jimmy Jab Games - a series of eccentric races and contests held in the precinct building

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine

programme.title: Come Dine with Me

programme.title: Come Dine with Me

programme.desc: The competition kicks off at the Bridge Hotel in Scunthorpe, owned by Martin and Hannah Weaver. Tom and Samara from The Crown at Whitchurch think the rooms are little more than functional. programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to Seashells B&B in Sutton-on-Sea, where owners Michelle and Rob Earp hope their simple residence with an animal twist will win the day. programme.title: Come Dine with Me

programme.title: Come Dine with Me

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Doctors run tests on 89-year-old Alyce, who has been brought to King's by ambulance after falling near her home. Soon after, 23-year-old groom-to-be Sean is examined following an epileptic seizure lasting most of the night

programme.title: Rescue: Extreme Medics
programme.desc: Medics in Glasgow rush to the scene of a 55-year-old farmer who has suffered a serious head injury, after falling through the roof of a barn. programme.title: Emergency Helicopter Medics
programme.desc: In Oxfordshire, cyclist Matt suffers life-threatening injuries after a collision with a car. On the A1, 64-year-old John is trapped in his car after a head-on collision. programme.title: Kirstie's House of Craft
programme.desc: Reality TV star Sam Thompson and TV personality Debbie McGee test their craft skills with pretty marbled clay napkin rings

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Jasmine Harman shows Pat Strachen from Aberdeen and her daughter Rachel five properties in Tenerife for her budget of £130,000. After holidaying on her favourite Canary Island for over 25 years, Pat now wants to take the plunge and spend her retirement there. It's a big, life-changing move, so can Jasmine find her that perfect home in the sun?

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun
programme.desc: A former DJ from Skegness opens a bar in Portugal, but falls foul of the law, while a couple's renovation of a B&B in Italy continues with one of them stuck in Wales

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Simon O'Brien and Henry Cole visit Witney in Oxfordshire, where Henry comes across a tractor that has not run for quite a few years - but poses no problem for restorer Alan

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien head to Tiverton in the West Country to meet petrolhead Roger. Henry finds part of a tornado jet that he wants to turn into a table, while Simon finds a pair of exhaust pipes, which he thinks could become a trendy pair of lamps

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: The death of a pathologist leads probate detectives to a family torn apart by tuberculosis. Plus, the search for the son of a deceased man who served in the Royal Army Medical corps, helping the wounded on the frontline of battle

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition kicks off at The Admiral Hotel in central London, run by owner So Shaw and hotel manager Kevin Jankunas. Chris Foster and his German companion Christel Richter are floored by the London prices, and Ursula Beswick and Daria Pakalnicka question the quality of the facilities. Despite So and Kevin's best efforts to charm their guests, a dinner conversation leaves Kris Malde and Vikki Cheatham making accusations of sexism and So and Kevin are outraged by some of their feedback

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to The Redstone in Blackpool, where high-end hotelier Ursula Beswick and manager Daria Pakalnicka hope their luxury guest house will win the day

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Chris Foster and Christel Richter invite the hoteliers to Ann's Farmhouse in the suburbs of Bradford, West Yorkshire, but tensions remain high between So, Kevin, Kris and Vikki

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to the R Inn in Desborough, Northamptonshire. The establishment is owned by entrepreneur Kris Malde, who's helped by events manager Vikki Cheetham. Kris opened the hotel to add corporate-style rooms for his events space next door. Ursula and Daria think the facilities are lacking and when the simmering tensions between So and Kevin and Kris and Vikki boil over at dinner, So refuses to stay the night. Chris and Christel reject the coffee at breakfast, and Kris and Vikki face some tough feedback

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: As the B&B owners meet for the last time, bones of contention include a missing biscuit, marks on a toilet seat and one guest is confronted about why they refused to stay the night. There are harsh words and home truths before the overall winner is revealed

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer search Glasgow with two couples whose budgets will not stretch to what they want. Kirstie is with Laura and Euan, who have recently returned to their native Glasgow from Sydney. But they are torn between their desire to be close to the vibrant West End or further out, where their budget will buy them something bigger. Phil has a wide brief with Miriam and David, who have spent eight months searching for their new home. He soon has success - the only problem is, they have each fallen for a different house

programme.title: Kirstie and Phil's Love It or List It
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer meet the Tuck family in Long Eaton, Derbyshire, who have grown weary of their cramped, three bedroom semi-detached home. Kirstie offers her thoughts on ways the family could change the downstairs of the property, while Phil sets out to find a suitable house they could buy instead

programme.title: Escape to the Chateau
programme.desc: Dick and Angel are warming up for one of the year's biggest events - Angel's parents' 50th wedding anniversary, which involves inviting more than 100 people to a huge party. There's a bespoke menu to plan and prepare, so Dick has called in the cavalry, with his son James arriving from Cornwall. Together with some help from Arthur, the Strawbridge boys have their work cut out as they create dishes they hope will strike a chord with everyone

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud follows plumber Jon Martin and ceramicist Noreen Jaafar as they transform a neglected half-acre site in Gloucestershire. However, they are unable to cut down the 27 protected trees on the plot, so their solution is to build a big, modern treehouse with stilts screwed into the earth and balconies that will have views for miles

programme.title: The Royals: A History of Scandals
programme.desc: From medieval to modern times, British monarchs have always been at the centre of scandals. Professor Suzannah Lipscomb looks at the roles the press, parliament and public have played over the centuries in generating outrage and spreading rumours. Dr Joanne Paul, Professor Matthew McCormack and Dr Anna Senkiw help Suzannah investigate some of the most notorious cold cases involving royals from the past, here focusing on suspicious deaths

programme.title: Queen Victoria's Last Love: Abdul Karim
programme.desc: The monarch's relationship with Indian servant Abdul Karim. He was initially employed as a waiter but soon rose to become Victoria's confidant and teacher, giving her daily lessons in Hindustani. His position violated racial and class taboos of the period, and the presence of a Muslim at the heart of the royal household caused problems for the politics of Empire, leading to a dramatic confrontation between the Queen and her family in 1897, which threatened to disrupt her Diamond Jubilee celebrations. Narrated by Geoffrey Palmer

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Among those arriving at King's College Hospital is 56-year-old Malcolm, who is put on life support after a cardiac arrest. Nightclub host Phil, 36, receives treatment for chronic pain in his back and side, and realises his party lifestyle is taking its toll, while medics discover 61-year-old Bob has suffered a stroke. Doctors also see to Kamilla, 12, who has been knocked down by a car on a pedestrian crossing

programme.title: The Royals: A History of Scandals
programme.desc: From medieval to modern times, British monarchs have always been at the centre of scandals. Professor Suzannah Lipscomb looks at the roles the press, parliament and public have played over the centuries in generating outrage and spreading rumours. Dr Joanne Paul, Professor Matthew McCormack and Dr Anna Senkiw help Suzannah investigate some of the most notorious cold cases involving royals from the past, here focusing on suspicious deaths

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jon Richardson and Lucy Beaumont take on Roisin Conaty and Joe Wilkinson in the comedy words-and-numbers game, while Bec Hill joins Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner. Hosted by Jimmy Carr, with Rachel Riley looking after the numbers and letters

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Among those arriving at King's College Hospital is 56-year-old Malcolm, who is put on life support after a cardiac arrest. Nightclub host Phil, 36, receives treatment for chronic pain in his back and side, and realises his party lifestyle is taking its toll, while medics discover 61-year-old Bob has suffered a stroke. Doctors also see to Kamilla, 12, who has been knocked down by a car on a pedestrian crossing

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Newlyweds Karen and John Leonard from Essex are about to retire. With the last of the six boys they have between them about to leave home, they're looking for a new adventure and a complete change of lifestyle. Scarlette Douglas shows them five properties in the sunny south of Gran Canaria for their budget of £175,000

programme.title: Kirstie's House of Craft
programme.desc: Comedians Rufus Hound and Jenny Eclair are challenged to make Kimono-style garments against the clock

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Laura Hamilton helps Sara and Paul from Derbyshire to find a holiday home in the Murcia region of south-eastern Spain. They're amazed by what their budget of £38,000 can buy them, but whether can they decide which property suits them best remains to be seen

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun
programme.desc: A couple with a new B&B argue over renovations, a family of brewers from Kent dash across the Channel to beat lockdown, and a restaurateur from Skegness' finances hang by a thread

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien head to Worcestershire to meet mechanic Adrian. Simon restores an old, wrecked armchair into some punk-rock furniture

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien travel to Surrey to meet upcycler Rob, who has a range of sheds a few miles from Gatwick Airport

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: In Hatfield, Hertfordshire, a researcher struggles to find any clues from neighbours about a retired factory worker whose father survived a First World War PoW camp

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition kicks off in Falmouth, Cornwall, where Gaye Woods hopes her family run Meudon Hotel will win the day. However, guests Tim and Mikey think their twin beds are too close for comfort. For some afternoon fun, Gaye lays on some oyster shucking. At dinner, some of the group are unconvinced by the high room rates and at breakfast, guests Sue and Chris reveal a picky streak. When Gaye receives her feedback, she's left wanting answers

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to the Royal Oak pub in Malborough, Devon, run by laid-back owner Tim Heap, with help from his barman Mikey Martindale. The basic rooms are a hit with some guests, but Geoff and Joan discover a mucky corner cupboard. Tim and Mikey take the group to an art workshop for some creative fun. At dinner, the guests are itching to know more about Tim's past and he doesn't disappoint, but he's riled when Gaye questions his unconventional management style. Following some unwanted extras at breakfast, some tough feedback makes Tim suspicious

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit is to the Angel Guest House in Tiverton, Devon, where owners Chris and Sue Holliday have created a homespun experience. Gaye is concerned by the noise of the road outside, and Joan and Geoff question some design choices in their room. During an afternoon playing a local game known as Throw the Egg, the group rumbles how competitive their hosts are. At dinner, Tim's enthusiasm results in an unexpected gift. Egg connoisseur Chris's poached eggs are put to the test at breakfast

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The fourth visit is to Geoff Jones and Joan McGowan's Compton Swan in Newbury, Berkshire. Expectations are high after Joan revealed she was named Ireland's Businesswoman of the Year on the last visit, but Tim, who's still smarting from his feedback, goes to town on his room. Tensions mount during an afternoon on an inflatable racecourse, where Chris and Sue try to sabotage the race. Geoff and Joan impress with a harpist at dinner and hearts are softened when they reveal the personal sacrifices they make for their business. At breakfast, Geoff the chef impresses, but egg-man Chris takes issues with his food

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final day in the competition sees the B&B owners meet for the last time to find out what they have been paid and settle some scores

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Phil Spencer catches up with two sets of serial renters who had very particular tastes, beginning with serial renters Mike and Poppy. Mike has lived in 18 homes, but Poppy wants to put down roots and they've chosen Cheshire as the right spot for their family. However, living in a high spec rental has given them great expectations for the home they'd love to own. Meanwhile, James and Hayley are looking for a rural retreat for themselves and their two dogs in Swindon and Newbury. But they are the first ones to admit that their wish list is extravagant, making Phil Spencer's job a tough one

programme.title: Kirstie and Phil's Love It or List It
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer help the Clayton-Fishers, who have fallen out of love with their home in Walthamstow, east London. Sarah and her wife Pepper have opposing views on what to do with their two-bedroom terrace, as Sarah thinks it is time to move on, but Pepper is digging her heels in and wants to convert the loft

programme.title: Escape to the Chateau
programme.desc: Dick Strawbridge and Angel Adoree host their last wedding of the year, and they welcome a fleet of vintage Citroens, whose drivers are making a pit-stop on a charity tour around France. After a sumptuous breakfast, the cars are on their way, and Dick, Angel, Arthur and Dorothy can focus on a retro vehicle of their own, the 1980s Asquith bus. With Angel's unique design, and Dick's engineering, it soon becomes the camper van the family dreamed of

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Natasha Cargill wants to build a home shaped like two enormous periscopes in rural Norfolk, but to obtain planning permission, she has to ensure not only that the materials are sustainable, but also agree to measure the transportation used to deliver them. If these strict criteria are not met, she won't be allowed to live there, and to add to the pressure, she has just £330,000 to spend on construction and six months to complete the project. Kevin McCloud follows her progress

programme.title: 2022: The Year from Space
programme.desc: Images of the world filmed by satellites over the course of 2022. The film includes footage of the destruction caused during the wars in Ukraine and Tigray, and of wildfires across Europe, as well as the aftermath of Covid lockdowns, as crowds are recorded returning to cities around the world. There is also footage of summer festivals, including Glastonbury and Burning Man. The film also documents the natural world, discovering existence of unknown colonies of king penguins in Antarctica and the plumes of herring spawn in the Pacific

programme.title: Caught on Camera
programme.desc: Cameras reveal what can go wrong when a dream holiday turns into a nightmare. Footage includes sunbed dashes, ski crashes, Brits behaving badly and locals behaving madly, all told by the people who were there. Psychologists and industry experts also reflect on the anxieties and situations that many can experience during a break

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Tensions run high at King's College Hospital when police suspect a patient is concealing a weapon, while maybe mother-of-four Hillary arrives in resus with a severe head injury after falling from her horse. Icylyn's bloated abdomen baffles the medical team and she has to wait overnight for a diagnosis, and 14-year-old Chloe receives treatment following her involvement in a fight

programme.title: 999: On the Front Line
programme.desc: Paramedics rush to save the life of a cyclist who has been crushed by a lorry in Leamington Spa, and in Coventry, a man is treated after falling from a barge

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown

programme.title: Mega Air
programme.desc: The world's biggest air package handling facility at UPS Worldport, which sorts two million items per night for worldwide delivery. Fireman also tackle a mock air freighter inferno

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: The chef reveals the Cornwall that he knows and loves, championing the food, history, music, art and culture of the county,. He begins at his family home in Trevose Head on the north coast, where as a child he would go fishing with his father

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: Rick meets a family who make some of the best Gouda cheese in Britain, and uses their creations to make a tortilla dish with caramelised apples and onions. In the fishing village of Mevagissey, he discovers the origins of the sea shanty and the history of the pilchard fishing industry, when shoals of pilchards were so large they would attract killer whales

programme.title: Red Bull Soapbox Race: USA's Greatest Moments
programme.desc: Highlights of some of the best, wackiest and craziest soapboxes and the biggest and most spectacular crashes from over the years and many competitions in the USA

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Freddie Flintoff, Chris Harris and Paddy McGuinness head on an icy expedition across the wild Scottish Highlands in the new Land Rover Defender, Mercedes G-Wagen and Ariel Nomad to see which vehicle will prove itself the ultimate off-roader

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Freddie Flintoff, Chris Harris and Paddy McGuinness confront the male mid-life crisis by buying the perfect sports cars for a middle-aged gentleman. Back at the track, Chris tests out the raucous new Toyota GR Yaris hot hatch

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Motoring magazine

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lucy accidentally runs over a pet rabbit belonging to the daughter of an important client, so she needs someone to help cover her tracks. Unfortunately, the best people she has are Lee and Daisy. Comedy, starring Lee Mack, Sally Bretton and Katy Wix

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lee, Lucy and Daisy go on a skiing trip to Eastern Europe, but as usual disaster isn't far behind. programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lucy becomes a relationship counsellor, so Lee and his father take advantage of her new-found skills in an effort to patch things up between them. Can they finally forgive and forget? Bobby Ball guest stars as Frank, with Lee Mack, Sally Bretton and Katy Wix

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Comedy panel show, with Strictly Come Dancing judge Craig Revel Horwood, actress Sheila Hancock and 8 Out of 10 Cats regular Jon Richardson arguing to have the things they hate consigned to the notorious room, while host Frank Skinner has the final say. Their gripes include house guests, women's toilets and dancing - and one of the celebrities even wants rid of their own brain

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Frank Skinner welcomes Pointless co-host Richard Osman, broadcaster Joan Bakewell and comedian Roisin Conaty to discuss their pet hates, in the hope of having them banished to Room 101. Their gripes include Bambi, chewing gum and cobblers

programme.desc: German comedian Henning Wehn, West End star Michael Ball and actress-presenter Caroline Quentin reveal their pet hates to Frank Skinner, in the hope he will banish them to Room 101. programme.desc: Special police task forces tackle a hit-and-run in Lancashire which turns out to be a deliberate attack on a single mum, and they also tackle a drug-dealing family dynasty in Bury

programme.desc: Richard Ayoade hosts an extended edition of the satirical news quiz, with comedian Maisie Adam and journalist Justin Webb joining team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton

programme.title: Red Dwarf
programme.desc: Lister accidentally triggers off the ship's self-destruct sequence, and there is only one way to diffuse the bomb, by lending his body to a female officer. Cult sci-fi comedy, starring Chris Barrie, Craig Charles and Danny John-Jules

programme.title: Red Dwarf
programme.desc: Kryten discovers a developing fluid has mutated, causing photographs to come to life and giving Lister a chance to change the past and avoid ever becoming lost in deep space. Sci-fi comedy, starring Chris Barrie, Craig Charles, Robert Llewellyn and Danny John-Jules

programme.title: Red Dwarf
programme.desc: Kryten discovers his expiry date is less than 24 hours away, prompting Lister and Rimmer to organise a party he will never forget, but when the mechanoid decides to avoid being shut down he does not realise his actions could cost the rest of the crew their lives. Sci-fi comedy, starring Craig Charles and Chris Barrie

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You

programme.title: Fast Justice
programme.desc: Observational documentary series on the road with Suffolk Police officers. armed with camera technology and high-speed pursuit cars, to track down the county's most wanted. The Sentinels take down a major organised crime group, suspected of smuggling drugs into the county, in a series of intense chases in a tense operation taking place over several weeks

programme.title: Cops on the Rock
programme.desc: Documentary series following the work of the Royal Gibraltar Police, as they deal with everything from cannabis smugglers to cocaine dealers and sinking boats. The drug squad arrest three men for dealing coke and also find hash in a bush at a beauty spot

programme.title: Survivor South Africa
programme.desc: The reality contest set in the Palawan province of the Philippines nears its end. Tom comes to accept the fact that he has to betray Werner in order to win with how the jury has come to be

programme.title: Rick Stein's Secret France
programme.desc: The chef continues his 'journey without maps', leaving the main routes and tourist hotspots behind to embark on a personal road trip along picturesque and remote backroads. Here, he heads through France's eastern border regions of Alsace and Jura - famous for Comte cheese and home to his favourite French dish of choucroute garni. He then begins to head inland, visiting Burgundy for a memorable glass of Auxey-Duresses wine, and sampling oeuf en meurette with a difference. Following a memorable Sunday lunch near the French/Swiss border, he is inspired to recreate a traditional blueberry tart

programme.title: Fast Justice
programme.desc: The Sentinels chase a suspected drug dealer who flees. Elsewhere, the team uncover a boot full of stolen goods and an uncooperative driver causes a scene in Ipswich town centre

programme.title: Border Force: America's Gatekeepers
programme.desc: Officers discover UPS packages lined with drugs. A 14-year-old runaway is picked up at the Gateway to the Americas Bridge. A mother is caught trying to smuggle marijuana

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May put three supercars through their paces in Italy. Their weapons of choice are the 691bhp Lamborghini Aventador, McLaren's hi-tech MP4-12C, and a British brute in the form of the Noble M600. The journey begins at Nardo, a high-speed testing ground so vast it can be seen from space, and includes a nerve-racking drive in Rome before reaching its conclusion with a timed challenge against the Stig at the Imola circuit

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson and James May travel to Beijing to learn about China's car industry, which has seen great expansion in recent years - but also have a violent encounter with one of the Stig's cousins. Meanwhile, Richard Hammond immerses himself in the world of Nascar at a race in Texas, and the Mercedes-Benz SLS AMG Roadster is wrestled around the test track, emitting serious amounts of noise and smoke in the process. Future host Matt LeBlanc is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car

programme.title: Survivor South Africa
programme.desc: The thrilling finale of the sixth series of the hit format. After seemingly an eternity away, the final Tribal Council takes place, drama unfolds, and the Ultimate Survivor is decided.

In the opening show, the big names with an even bigger axe to grind are one-time Doctor Who and Broadchurch star David Tennant, veteran broadcaster Trevor McDonald, and actress, writer and comedian Aisling Bea. Sushi, flossing, pigeons, lateness and queuing are just some of the things that get this trio's backs up - but who will Frank decide has made the most persuasive argument?

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Rob Brydon hosts a festive edition of the comedy panel show in which the participants aim to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves in a bid to secure a team victory. Joining team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack for the Christmas fun are former Test Match Special commentator Henry Blofeld, Witless star Kerry Howard, broadcaster the Rev Richard Coles and BBC News presenter Clive Myrie. They all reveal amazing stories, but are they telling the truth, or making it all up?

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lee Mack and Sally Bretton star in the domestic comedy which sees the couple appear to go from one disaster to the next, while coping with their three kids, Lucy's disapproving parents, Lee's feckless dad Frank and their world-weary friends Toby and Anna. This week the couple become addicted to a TV box set, causing them to cancel dinner with Toby and Anna at the last moment. But when they lie about the reason, it only succeeds in opening up a huge can of worms. Domestic comedy, with Hugh Dennis and Abigail Cruttenden

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lee and Lucy are trying to make the family healthier, so they are not too happy about the school lollipop man handing out sweets to the kids. Domestic comedy, starring Lee Mack and Sally Bretton

programme.title: Australia with Julia Bradbury
programme.desc: Presenter Julia Bradbury travels 12,000km as she explores all four corners of Australia, finding out about the continent and the people who live there. She begins in Sydney, exploring the harbour and heading backstage at the famous opera house. At Bondi Beach she joins a shoreline patrol and visits a tattoo parlour, before she joins the local drag queens for a memorable night

programme.title: Australia with Julia Bradbury
programme.desc: Presenter Julia Bradbury continues her epic journey across Australia, exploring all four corners as she finds out about the continent and the people who live there. Her next step is the Blue Mountains, a rugged region in New South Wales. Along the way she has a go at paddle boarding with pooches, meets Australia's favourite koala and has a chat with fashion designer Jenny Kee. She also takes a ride on the world's steepest railway, and her hike through the mountains ends with a sighting of the bowerbird

programme.title: Australia with Julia Bradbury
programme.desc: Julia meets backpackers in Cairns and heads out to an island turtle sanctuary. She also treks through the oldest rainforest in the world and gets a taste for green ants. Finally, the caretakers of an idyllic island introduce her to the magic of the Great Barrier Reef

programme.title: Australia with Julia Bradbury
programme.desc: The presenter continues her 12,000km journey across the continent with a tour of Western Australia. She meets some of the millionaire boat-builders and surfers in the city of Perth, then moves more than 2,000km north along the coast to Broome, where she enjoys a day at the races. Finally she ventures into the Outback to find out about life with an Aboriginal family

programme.title: Australia with Julia Bradbury
programme.desc: Julia continues her 12,000km journey across the continent with a tour of the Northern Territory. She embarks on a crocodile safari in the wetlands of the Northern Territory, before relaxing in Darwin, home of the Ghan train. She then hits the open road with a retiree who now travels the country - or as the Aussies call them 'grey nomads' - to discover life on one of Australia's vast cattle stations

programme.title: Australia with Julia Bradbury
programme.desc: Julia continues her 12,000km journey across the continent in Central Australia, a huge outback region of the Northern Territory also known as the Red Centre. She begins in the town of Alice Springs, where she is persuaded to take part in a dry boat race. She also heads back to the classroom at the world's largest school, meets a retired Aussie soap star at his desert home and takes a camel ride to the sacred site of Uluru, or Ayers Rock

programme.title: Australia with Julia Bradbury
programme.desc: Julia reaches South Australia as she continues her 12,000km journey across the continent. She drives along the Explorers Way, a route through the Outback mapped out by a pioneer in 1862, to the world's most isolated pub, where a small plane takes her on to the ancient landscape of the Painted Hills. In Adelaide, she climbs the roof of the Oval sports stadium and meets a women's cycling team, before ending her journey in wine country

programme.title: Australia with Julia Bradbury
programme.desc: For the final leg of her journey around Australian journey, Julia drives along the Great Ocean Road toward Melbourne. Along the way she watches koalas while enjoying a cuppa, discovers a golf course where kangaroos share the links, paddles with platypuses and spots wombats at dusk

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo embarks on a new journey following his Bradshaw's handbook from south-west Wales to Cambridge, beginning in Pembroke Dock, where Queen Victoria's royal yachts were built. In the little market town of Naberth he investigates what caused rebels to dress up as women, later spending the night at an inn in Carmarthen where Horatio Nelson once met Emma Hamilton. Next day, the former politician pitches in with the volunteers who look after the Gwili Heritage line and ends his leg in Swansea, where he learns how to pose for a photograph in Victorian style

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo begins in the ruinous gardens at Aberglasney House near Llandeilo before riding shotgun in the driver's cab on one of the most scenic routes in Britain. programme.desc: In Greece, business is booming for two gastronomic tour guides. In Italy, a Manchester couple's wilderness retreat plans are threatened by a mobile phone mast. Elsewhere, a Lincolnshire family rolls out a new menu at their Spanish hotel

programme.desc: Leah Charles-King helps Jane and Neil find their perfect holiday home in Gran Alacant on a budget of £100,000

programme.desc: he group are tasked with an energy-sapping uphill hike, before being confronted with a 200-foot abseil into a dark bat-infested cave. Later in a bustling civilian market, the recruits must track down an armed gunman on the loose among innocent civilians. Will they be able to locate the target and take them down?

programme.title: In the Footsteps of Killers
programme.desc: In June 1989, 18-year-old Tina Bell vanished after leaving her family home in Billingham, Teesside, to buy some sweets. Ten months later her body was found on nearby wasteland and forensic analysis showed the remains had been dissolved in acid. Emilia Fox, Professor David Wilson and Dr Graham Hill investigate Tina's murder and uncover some sinister events in the community that could be connected to her murder

programme.title: Grayson Perry's Full English
programme.desc: The artist travels through the north of England, beginning his journey on the northern soul scene in Wigan, where he finds this musical genre that developed into a 1960s subculture still has a grip on local people. programme.title: A Lake District Farm Shop

programme.title: Come Dine with Me

programme.desc: In Manchester, voiceover artist and film extra Matt cooks up a Jewish Friday night supper, including his mum's traditional chicken soup

programme.desc: Budding author and mum-of-five Cleona is next to host in Manchester, hoping a menu based on her Jamaican roots will get her guests onside

programme.desc: Alison Lynch hosts the dinner party in Edinburgh, and attempts to win her guests over with a ju-jitsu-themed evening. Rena Martin appears to be endearing herself to the group, and Cynthia Gentle impresses Gary Reid by telling him what she can do with a mango

programme.title: 999: On the Front Line
programme.desc: A woman falls getting off a bus and badly cuts her leg, and a pharmacist calls 999, worried that a child's rash could be a sign of meningitis. A holiday ends abruptly when a cut to a man's arm won't stop bleeding. A woman with cerebral palsy can't walk and needs medical help, and a man has a heart rate so low he could go into cardiac arrest at any moment

programme.title: In the Footsteps of Killers
programme.desc: In June 1989, 18-year-old Tina Bell vanished after leaving her family home in Billingham, Teesside, to buy some sweets. Ten months later her body was found on nearby wasteland and forensic analysis showed the remains had been dissolved in acid. Emilia Fox, Professor David Wilson and Dr Graham Hill investigate Tina's murder and uncover some sinister events in the community that could be connected to her murder

programme.title: Guy Martin's Great British Power Trip
programme.desc: As an energy crisis and cost of living crisis collide, the Lincolnshire lorry mechanic and motorcycle racer investigates the past, present and future of British power stations to work out how the country makes its most valuable commodity of all - electricity. This first episode begins with Guy testing every piece of equipment in his workshop to find out which items use the most electricity. Horrified by what he's now having to pay for power, he tries to work out the reasons behind his big bills, and visits his local power station at Drax - which also happens to be the country's biggest. The full series will be available to stream or download for free on All 4 after the transmission of this episode.

programme.desc: Guy Phoenix and his team are on a mission to complete their latest superhome build in Nottingham on time and gives a tour of one of his previous property builds. Narrated by Philip Glenister

programme.desc: Maître d' Fred Sirieix and his team prepare once again to play Cupid at their Manchester restaurant. Essex-born cleaning fanatic Fleur is paired with Essex boy Louis, who reveals he has been working as a high-end escort. Thirty five-year-old Ian, from Co Durham, is full of contradictions, which include working as a gas fitter while also running an art gallery with a champagne bar. it remains to be seen if similarly-aged medical lab assistant Michaela could be the woman to love all of his quirks

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin meets Mike and Sarah, who bought a remote smallholding in the Derbyshire Dales, somewhere to rear animals and provide a home for themselves and their elderly parents. Kevin follows the couple as they set out to build a 21st-century version of a historic Derbyshire longhouse. Enormous, corrugated and with a highly complex roof shape, it was never going to be an easy build. But soon they face delays and their schedule begins to slide. However, that is nothing compared with the problems of a more personal nature that hit the project

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud follows the progress of Mimi and Andre d'Costa, who have moved to the Kent countryside to bring up their two children. They have a large plot of land and want to build a house that will be functional enough to serve their young family, but will also blend in with the beautiful landscape. They turn to architect Nick Eldridge, who designs a simple modular home using state-of-the-art materials and technologies

programme.title: George Clarke's Amazing Spaces
programme.desc: A Welsh farmer and his wife plan to upcycle an old horse lorry into a perfect seaside retreat, and George meets a man planning to add a two-storey tepee to his American-inspired campsite. In Israel, the presenter falls for a fantastic modern home and visits a small experimental building made from hemp, which could point the way to a greener future for the construction industry. For his own caravan build, George takes inspiration from an amazing arts and crafts terrace house in Cambridge, and gets together with build partner Max McMurdo to work out how to create an 'invisible' desk

programme.title: Food Unwrapped

programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc: Officers in York are forced into one of their most dangerous pursuits after a report of a stolen car travelling at recklessly high speeds towards the city centre. programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc: A prolific car thief with a string of convictions under his belt crashes and rolls a stolen car at over 100mph, while in Harrogate the hunt for a cloned car and disqualified driver leads to a high-speed pursuit. programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc: The return of the programme offering an insight into the work of officers patrolling the roads of Derbyshire. programme.title: Traffic Cops

programme.title: Traffic Cops

programme.title: Traffic Cops

programme.desc: Police action to close down an illegal dog-fighting ring leads to a murder inquiry when officers find a woman's finger inside one of the creatures. programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: A jeweller's murder is linked to a prostitution business, and the subsequent trial puts McCoy's job on the line as interested parties try to call in old favours. Award-winning police drama, starring Sam Waterston

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Gibbs is called to a frozen lake, where two children have discovered the body of a missing US Marine. The team searches the water for clues and finds three more bullet-ridden corpses, all of which have tattoos linking them to a notorious street gang. The case then becomes a race against time to discover what connects the murders before the serviceman's comrades seek revenge

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Gibbs is assigned to examine the apparent suicide of a Pentagon cryptographer suspected of spying. The case is thrown into disarray by the discovery of evidence indicating another person was present at the time of death - meaning the real mole may still be on the loose and has already killed at least once. Crime drama, with Mark Harmon and David McCallum

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Abby becomes the target of an assassination attempt while working in the lab - and the team's search for her would-be killer leads to the main suspect in an embezzlement trial at which she is appearing as a witness. programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit

programme.title: Motorway Patrol
programme.desc: Documentary following members of the New Zealand highway patrol as they witness some of the best and worst behaviour on the nation's motorways. The series is centred around the roads of Auckland, the country's largest urban area, and features motoring chaos including major traffic collisions, escaped animals and pedestrians on busy roads. There is also footage of drivers falling asleep at the wheel, overloaded vehicles and suspects caught with illegal substances - plus a host of excuses as the people pulled over try to persuade officers they have not done anything wrong
