programme.title: London's Weekend
programme.desc: A chance to catch up on the week's headlines and a taste of what to see and do in London this weekend

programme.title: Blenheim
programme.desc: A triathlon is held at the stately home. Among those competitors tackling the swimming, cycling and running event are some of the Duke of Marlborough's staff, vying to avoid embarrassment amid the more experienced participants. Annabel Hampson narrates

programme.title: Blenheim
programme.desc: The Caravan Club celebrates its centenary with a rally at the Palace but rain threatens to put a damper on the event until Bobby Davro is drafted in by the Duke of Marlborough to cheer up the campers

programme.title: The Prisoner
programme.desc: Number Six strives to discover the identity of the mysterious figure behind the craze for accelerated learning sweeping the Village, to prove that knowledge does not equal wisdom. Vintage drama series, starring Patrick McGoohan

programme.title: My Greek Odyssey
programme.desc: Peter Maneas journeys through some of the most spectacular and unique Greek islands, exploring the rich culture, history and food of Greece while meeting the locals and those who live there

programme.title: The Most Dangerous Ways to School
programme.desc: They climb up mountainous paths, swim across rivers or fight their way through icy wastelands. Travelling through amazing natural landscapes, they are simply students on their way to school

programme.title: The Courtneys of Curzon Street (1947)
programme.desc: An aristocrat scandalously marries his mother's maid, and their family endures a series of crises over the next four generations. Period drama, with Anna Neagle and Michael Wilding

programme.title: The Battle of the Sexes (1960)
programme.desc: An elderly Scottish clerk tries to sabotage the new methods introduced by an American efficiency expert reorganising the old-fashioned firm where he works. However, when he realises his boss thinks the new arrival can do no wrong, he is left with just one option - murder her. Comedy, starring Peter Sellers, Constance Cummings, Roddy McMillan, Robert Morley and Jameson Clark

programme.title: London Districts
programme.desc: Short visual tours exploring and revealing lesser known areas of London for locals and tourists. Narrated by Dewyne Lindsay

programme.title: How to Succeed in Business Without Really Trying (1967)
programme.desc: A lowly window cleaner uses his wiles and ruthlessness to climb the corporate ladder. Musical comedy based on the Broadway show, starring Robert Morse, Michele Lee, Rudy Vallee and Anthony Teague

programme.title: Blandings
programme.desc: Clarence and Connie are horrified when their terrifying sister Charlotte arrives and threatens to take up permanent residence, so Freddie comes to the rescue with an audacious plan that involves stealing the lord's beloved pig. Period comedy based on the stories by PG Wodehouse, starring Timothy Spall and Jennifer Saunders, with a guest appearance by Celia Imrie as their indomitable sibling

programme.title: Secrets of London with Mark Monroe
programme.desc: London icon the Golden cycling man of Wimbledon gives his first ever public interview

programme.title: Tabernacle Choir: Music and Words
programme.desc: The Tabernacle Choir from Temple Square, Music and the Spoken Word, providing music and inspiration for everyday living from one of the world's top ten choirs featuring regular guest artists.

programme.title: Inside Tatler
programme.desc: Documentary going behind the scenes at the fashion and lifestyle magazine aimed at those people moving in the circles of Britain's high society, not only documenting, but also dictating the social calendar of Britain's ruling classes. The programme follows editor Kate Reardon and her features team as they put together an issue, attending shoots and key social events to meet the people featured in their pages, including the Earl of Glasgow at his 13th-century castle in North Ayrshire, and Nigerian millionaire Kola Karim, who has no idea how many cars he owns

programme.title: My Greek Odyssey
programme.desc: Peter Maneas journeys through some of the most spectacular and unique Greek islands, exploring the rich culture, history and food of Greece while meeting the locals and those who live there

programme.title: O Mary This London (1994)
programme.desc: Three young Dubliners go to London in search of fun, fortune and, in the case of 17-year-old Mary Kelly, an abortion. Drama, starring Jason Barry and Oba Seagrave

programme.title: Brakes (2016)
programme.desc: Comedy outlining the seemingly random and fragile nature of the connections that can lead to people becoming part of a couple, showing the final stages of a number of relationships then flashing back to how they got together. Starring Julian Barratt, Kerry Fox and Paul McGann

programme.title: The Escape Artist
programme.desc: David Tennant stars in this drama as Will Burton, a highly talented junior barrister who is in great demand, having never lost a case, much to the frustration of his courtroom rival Maggie Gardner. But when he successfully defends Liam Foyle, who was standing trial for a high-profile murder, he has reason to regret his peerless legal skills. For Foyle is a serial killer - and before long he is on the hunt for his next victim. Ashley Jensen, Sophie Okonedo and Toby Kebbell co-star

programme.title: Secrets of London with Mark Monroe
programme.desc: The amazing life story of a west London man and the heroic selfless acts he carried out at Hammersmith Bridge

programme.title: Blandings
programme.desc: Clarence and Connie are horrified when their terrifying sister Charlotte arrives and threatens to take up permanent residence, so Freddie comes to the rescue with an audacious plan that involves stealing the lord's beloved pig. Period comedy based on the stories by PG Wodehouse, starring Timothy Spall and Jennifer Saunders, with a guest appearance by Celia Imrie as their indomitable sibling

programme.title: News Rewind
programme.desc: A digest of news and events from across London from the past few days

programme.title: Talking Points
programme.desc: Current affairs affecting Londoners today and a look at the latest shows and films in the capital

programme.title: Roswell Conspiracies
programme.desc: The story of allied intelligence agents who've discovered aliens on Earth who are bent on taking over the world. In response, the agents form a top-secret multinational agency, The Global Alliance

programme.title: Dork Hunters from Outer Space
programme.desc: Alien Dorks disguise themselves as humans to use Earth as a base to take over the universe, but they face opposition from some unlikely teenage heroes

programme.title: Pocket Dragon Adventures
programme.desc: A group of very small dragons live with a kindly old wizard, they're not big enough to fly but that doesn't stop them having many adventures

programme.title: Extreme Dinosaurs
programme.desc: 65 Million years ago, Dinosaurs disappeared. Now they're Back! T-Bone, Spike, Bullzeye, and Stegz. Four prehistoric dinosaurs, evolved into intelligent beings reawaken in a bizarre new world

programme.title: Stone Age
programme.desc: Meet a group of typical suburban nine-year-old kids with friends, foes and families kicking it really old school, in prehistoric times

programme.title: Stone Age
programme.desc: Meet a group of typical suburban nine-year-old kids with friends, foes and families kicking it really old school, in prehistoric times

programme.title: Legend of the Dragon
programme.desc: Ling lures Ang and Xuan to the Tiger Temple, where the Snake Guardian is bitten by a huge king cobra

programme.title: Blandings
programme.desc: Clarence must prevent his rakish younger brother Galahad (guest star Julian Rhind-Tutt) from publishing his scandalous memoirs and damaging the family name. If the earl fails, he will be exiled to hellish London by Connie. Period comedy based on the stories by PG Wodehouse, with Timothy Spall, Jennifer Saunders, Jack Farthing, Tim Vine and Robert Bathurst

programme.title: Secrets of London with Mark Monroe
programme.desc: London cabbie Mark Monroe takes you to the hidden and more quirky parts of this amazing city that normally lie undiscovered

programme.title: Plane Crash Recreated
programme.desc: Reconstructions of high-profile aviation disasters, featuring Lion Air Flight 610, which was just 13 minutes into flight from Jakarta, Indonesia, when it plunged into the sea on October 29, 2018. Plus, the 737 Max serving Ethiopian Airlines Flight 302, which crashed six minutes after take-off from Ethiopia on March 10, 2019

programme.title: Terry and Mason's Great Food Trip
programme.desc: Terry Wogan and Mason McQueen head to Monmouthshire, to sample the mouthwatering delights of Abergavenny. The pair are impressed by the variety of locally produced food on offer in the market town known as the gateway to Wales and feast on a Nepalese curry, drink Welsh wine, try making sweets that the miners would have taken down the pit and drop into a Michelin-starred restaurant. They also attend a barbecue at the castle, where they are serenaded by a male voice choir

programme.title: Secrets of London with Mark Monroe
programme.desc: London cabbie Mark Monroe takes you to the hidden and more quirky parts of this amazing city that normally lie undiscovered

programme.title: Serving the Royals
programme.desc: Personal stories of the royal household's servants, including consultants, advisers and protectors of the House of Windsor

programme.title: Time Limit (1957)
programme.desc: A soldier held as a POW during the Korean War confesses to having assisted the enemy during his imprisonment. His superior officers are determined to see him face a court martial as soon as possible, but the investigator assigned to the case suspects he is an innocent man incriminating himself to hide something. Korean War drama, with Richard Widmark and Richard Basehart

programme.title: Payroll (1961)
programme.desc: The widow of an armoured car driver swears revenge on the criminals who killed him - leading them to turn on each other. Crime drama, staring Michael Craig and Billie Whitelaw

programme.title: Princess Diana: In Search of Happiness
programme.desc: A review of the life of Diana, Princess of Wales, including her childhood, her move into the public eye, her work for charity, her marriage and her death

programme.title: London Live News
programme.desc: News weather events and the best of the capital's culture. Join us to explore life in London

programme.title: The Baron
programme.desc: It would appear that the Mona Lisa has been stolen from the Louvre. But is it the actual Da Vinci painting or a forgery substituted to thwart the thieves?

programme.title: Michael Palin's New Europe
programme.desc: The veteran traveller completes his journey around eastern Europe. He learns how to skin a pig and make sausages in the Tatra mountains of Slovakia, enjoys a mud bath with the 2006 Miss World Tatana Kucharova in the spa town of Karlovy Vary and visits Turba's famous mime school in the Czech Republic. Finally, he travels to the holiday complex at Prora on the island of Rug, Germany, which was built by Hitler for his 'Strength Through Joy' programme

programme.title: The Comic Strip Presents
programme.desc: A wedding photographer drifts into surreal fantasies about the bride (Kate Bush), as the reception degenerates into a gunfight between the two families

programme.title: Quest Boxing League
programme.desc: Welcome to the UK's toughest boxing competition, where aspiring young boxers battle it out inside the ring for their chance to be crowned the Quest Boxing League Champion

programme.title: Everything Must Go (2010)
programme.desc: A man's heavy drinking costs him his job and leads to his wife kicking him out of the house. He sets up home on their lawn, amid all the possessions she has thrown out, and to avoid seeming homeless, he begins selling them, leading him to make new friendships with his neighbours and gradually straighten out his life. Comedy drama, starring Will Ferrell and Laura Dern

programme.title: The Village in the Woods (2019)
programme.desc: Troubled couple Jason and Rebecca get more than they bargain for when they inherit a remote fog-shrouded pub, It seems there's more to their neighbours than meets the eye, but have they got the newcomers' best interests at heart or are more sinister forces at play? Horror, starring Robert Vernon, Beth Park and Therese Bradley

programme.title: Born Equal
programme.desc: Drama by Bafta-winning writer and director Dominic Savage, about a group of characters from different social backgrounds whose paths collide at a B&B. A wealthy businessman's guilt about his luxurious lifestyle leads him to try to help those less fortunate, while a man recently released from prison embarks on a search for his mother. Starring Colin Firth, Robert Carlyle and Anne-Marie Duff

programme.desc: Documentary exploring areas of the capital, beginning with Shooters Hill, Charlton, Greenwich and Blackheath

programme.desc: Beach and Connie are far from impressed when Clarence grows a raggedy beard - but the least happy is Freddie, who has little chance of impressing Hollywood starlet Pauline Petite if his aristocratic father looks like an old tramp. Period comedy, starring Timothy Spall, Jennifer Saunders, Jack Farthing, Michael Brandon and Zoe Boyle

programme.title: Terry and Mason's Great Food Trip
programme.desc: Broadcaster Terry Wogan and London cabbie Mason McQueen visit Dorset and sample food from Dorchester, where they find out about some of the famous names associated with the town. They also dine at the courtroom of the hanging judge, Judge Jeffreys, and sample pie and chips at the old architect's office used by Thomas Hardy. Their pursuit for the best local food takes them to a garlic farm, a chocolate factory and a vicar who supplies the local cider

programme.title: Michael Palin's New Europe

programme.title: Two and Two Make Six (1961)
programme.desc: A womanising member of the US Air Force lands himself in trouble, goes AWOL and heads for the seaside, where he accidentally swaps girlfriends with a motorcyclist. Romantic comedy, starring George Chakiris, Janette Scott and Alfred Lynch

programme.title: Royal Road
programme.desc: The public activities of King George VI and Queen Elizabeth during the Second World War, as well as the Royal Family's private life in the gardens at Windsor

programme.title: The Royal Visit to Leith
programme.desc: Colourful commemoration of Royal Yacht Britannia's majestic visit to Leith in 1956, courtesy of Joseph and J Arthur Rank

programme.title: After Henry
programme.desc: 1990s British Sitcom. Series 6, Ep 6/6 The Other Married Man. Having sorted out the problem of Clare seeing a married man, Sarah now finds herself in an alarmingly similar situation.

programme.title: The Escape Artist
programme.desc: Liam Foyle is back in the dock and Maggie is leading his defence, determined to prove she is Will's equal by getting the serial killer acquitted. The prosecution barristers are less confident - with no physical evidence and key witness Will unable to get involved, they need all the help they can get. As the defendant continues to terrorise his loved ones, can the brilliant barrister find a way to assist without jeopardising the trial? Courtroom drama, starring David Tennant, Ashley Jensen, Sophie Okonedo and Toby Kebbell

programme.title: Dracula (1974)
programme.desc: The vampire count comes to Victorian London in pursuit of a woman who is the exact double of his long dead wife. Horror, starring Jack Palance and Simon Ward

programme.title: Saturday Church (2017)
programme.desc: Ulysses, a shy, bullied 14-year-old, lives with his mother, Amara, and younger brother. Given the recent passing of his father, Ulysses' Aunt Rose, agrees to help take care of him and his sibling while their mother is at work. He soon stumbles across a vibrant transgender community while trying to find his own identity. Writer/director Damon Cardasis's drama, starring Luka Kain, Regina Taylor and Margot Bingham
